description:
Req ID: 119647
Remote Position: No
Region: Europe
Country: Ireland
State/Province: Galway
City: Galway

Short Description
Engineering Manager

We are seeking new Engineering Manager to join our most recent Medical Device project, which involves building and delivering a fully automated production line. See the job description below

Celestica is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

Introduction

Who we are and what we do?

At Celestica, we enable the world's best brands. We build trusted relationships and solve complex technology challenges to help our customers realize greater value, potential and outcomes. We are a leader in high-reliability design, manufacturing and supply chain solutions that brings global expertise at every stage of product development – from the drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services. With talented teams across North America, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

A career at Celestica is only for those who want to do something extraordinary with a meaningful purpose: imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

By Joining Celestica Galway (Ireland) as an Engineering Manager, you will have the opportunity to work with an incredible team taking on the fantastic challenge of becoming a key member of the health-tech sector.

Your next challenge will be…

Lead a team of professionals in managing customer interface and engineering projects relating to product development, production and performance optimisation, within the Storage/Consumer/Industrial and Medical Device segment. This position will report to the Site General Manager.

Your day- to-day activities will include…

General

Oversees all Product engineering related activities for both within Storage/Consumer/Industrial and medical device automated production.
Manages the primary interface with Customers in supporting Product performance and the evolution of Product development.
Manages a team of professionals providing expertise in engineering operations in support of automated and manual production within business units.

New Business and NPI

Leads development of new business opportunities with current and potential Customers.
Holds accountability for the overall NPI process and ensures smooth transition from prototype to production.
Tracks the execution of the projects under development including technical issues, project budgets, and business issues.

Performance

Leads engineering analysis of under-performing production units or sub- assemblies. Develops solutions based upon existing knowledge, and leveraging industry and other sites capabilities.
Evaluates results of manufacturing, test, and quality assurance processes for product.
Ensures accurate and timely communication to management on critical technical and business issues.
Collaborates with internal operations teams and development partners to recommend and implement changes to product or process to reduce defects, improve quality, and lower costs.
Leads and provides guidance to extended Process and Quality engineering team regarding product application in field deployment.

Continuous Improvement

Holds responsibility for continuous improvement strategies within the Engineering department; this includes Engineering systems and Engineering standards to ensure the both project delivery and project design are continually improving.

Leadership

Manages internal and external resource levels to ensure project delivery capability in the most effective manner.
Responsible for employee training, performance, measurement, development, motivation and recognition within the Engineering Team.
Initiates the research and evaluation of new technology and processes.
What do we offer
Market-competitive total reward: flexible salary, fix and variable salary based on goals.
Training and development opportunities, with us the sky is the limit!
The opportunity to innovate, learn, mentor others and work toward your own vision of career success.
Become a key member of the Health Tech, driven by innovation where creativity matters.
Celestica offers a global, collaborative culture with strong leadership imperatives to foster your growth and professional opportunities.
We are focused on sustainability and provide opportunities for employees to give back to the community.
What do we expect from you?
8-10 years’ experience in a Senior Engineering role with 2+ year’s at management level.
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
Experience in multinational, manufacturing environment.
Experience of high volume, automated manufacturing processes.
Experience in medical device manufacturing processes.
Project Management experience and associated qualification.
Experience in New Product Introduction.
Experience in Continuous Improvement.
Excellent motivational / interpersonal skills.
Excellent customer management skills.
Knowledge of customer and FDA regulatory requirements in line with business needs.
What are we looking for?
In-depth knowledge and understanding of manufacturing processes and equipment, within Consumer and Medical Device industry.
In-depth knowledge of quality improvement practices and techniques.
Working knowledge of industrial digital printing and the requirements of OEM manufactures in the design and integration of digital printing technologies solutions that meet current market requirements.
Provide primary technical and quality management support to systemic customer quality issues, the management of customer reaction and containment teams with a digital industrial printing environment.
Ability to plan for and coordinate a wide variety of resources to meet production quality and quantity metrics.
Ability to effectively communicate with a wide variety of internal and external customers.
Ability to effectively lead, manage, train, coach and motivate a diverse group of employees to achieve high production levels within tight time deadlines and in a highly dynamic manufacturing environment.
Excellent leadership, negotiation, problem resolution and project management skills.
Strong analytical and statistical skills.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a wide variety of internal and external customer
Are you ready to unlock your full potential? Join us now!
Notes

This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).
At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud. Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.

Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.
Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

description:
An opportunity exists for a full-time Quality Engineer reporting to the Quality Manager to join our state-of-the-art plant in Clara, Co Offaly.

Responsible for and has the authority for product/process quality improvement programmes, analysis of quality costs, customer complaints, analysis of quality waste, reliability evaluations and process capabilities studies.

*Main Duties and Responsibilities*
*
* Ensure that safe working practices are adhered to at all times, including wearing PPE as appropriate. Acquire knowledge of Health & Safety procedures, work instructions, and associated documentation. Comply with all Health & Safety Policies and instructions and actively contribute to Company efforts to promote safe behaviour and safe systems of work.
* Lead quality improvement programmes using recognised problem-solving and project management techniques
* Participate in cross-functional teams to ensure that we achieve our Quality Policy and Quality Objectives
* Evaluate quality trends and reasons for product or process failures relating to customer complaints and lead corrective action plans.
* Evaluate quality costs and determine critical causes.
* Prepare and approve quality assurance specifications and assist in the formulation of written policy/procedures
* Align and integrate company test procedures with International Standards requirements.
* Assist in determining inspection frequencies and sampling plans using significance testing, capability studies and through collation and analysis of data
* Participate in validation of all new tooling equipment, methods and products.
* Perform receiving inspection, in process inspection, final inspection and first article inspection activities as required.
* Ensure all areas comply with specified regulatory requirements
* Liaise directly with customers and suppliers on quality related matters
* Any other reasonably duties as require



For additional information on Nelipak Healthcare Packaging, please visit our website on www.nelipak.com. Nelipak Healthcare Packaging is committed to equality of opportunity in employment and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified candidates irrespective of religion, gender or disability.

Company name: Edwards Vacuum Technology Ireland Ltd
Date of posting: Jan 10, 2024

f

About Edwards

Edwards is a leading developer and manufacturer of sophisticated vacuum products, exhaust management systems and related value-added services. Edwards solutions are integral to manufacturing processes for semiconductors, flat panel displays, LEDs and solar cells. They are also used within an increasingly diverse range of industrial processes including power, glass and other coating applications; steel and other metallurgy; pharmaceutical and chemical; and for scientific instruments in a wide range of R&D applications.

Edwards has over 4,000 employees worldwide engaged in the design, manufacture and support of high technology vacuum and exhaust management equipment. Edwards has state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Europe, Asia and North America.

*For English / French fluent candidates*

Based in Dublin, TLSE is the Irish subsidiary of a European industrial group (Talbot Industrie) operating in the marine, entertainment and handling markets with a premium niche products portfolio (www.goliath-store.com).

Leader in our markets (European), the distribution of our products is based on a strong partnership with a dense distribution network, and a complete and innovative range of products and services.

Settled in 4 countries, we have offices in France, Italy, Luxembourg and Ireland.
With 150 employees spread among 5 offices, we work daily with multitasking teams in a fast paced and innovative environment.

We believe in employee progression and recognising performance; we enjoy working hard, smart and having fun.

If you are ambitious, results focused and enjoy a challenge, you will enjoy working with us.

We are looking for a Design Engineer (2 yrs experience), specialised ideally in mechanics or electronics.

*The missions:*

* Mastering French is a necessity to carry out these missions (B2 minimum).
* Participation in the design and development of industrial products taking into account the budgetary and technical constraints and deadlines of the specifications.
* Realisation of manufacturing and purchasing plans.
* Calculation of cost prices.
* Validation of the design (calculations and static and dynamic tests).
* Prototyping.
* Industrialisation (definition and optimisation of the necessary investments over several phases).
* Pre-study or study of tools or means of production.

*What we offer:*

* International and young expanding working environment,
* Different manufacturing processes and varied product lines,
* Multitasking and team working atmosphere,
* Opportunity for a management career path.

*What we are looking for*:

* Higher technical training,
* Mastery of CAD software, ideally INVENTOR 2013, as well as computer tools (office automation),
* Good technical culture: vocabulary, mechanics, manufacturing industry,
* Focus on getting things done and achieving resolution to issues (not only identification),
* Knowledge of VAULT plan management software,
* Ability to learn fast and willingness to always master new skills,
* Inclination to travel for work.

Job Types: Permanent, Full-time

Salary: From €35,000.00 per year



Experience:
* industrial design: 1 year (preferred)

Language:
* French (required)

Willingness to travel:
* 25% (required)


Work Location: In person


Expected start date: 08/01/2024

description:
**BMC Manufacturing Design Engineers**

We operate from a 20,000 sq. ft. production facility in Ashbourne and a 40,000 sq ft facility in Ballycoolin, manufacturing Low Voltage switchgear and Motor Control Centres. We have a highly trained, experienced and dedicated staff, who provide a quality product and service for our customers. We recognise the need to keep up with developing technology, with this in mind we use the latest computer-based estimating, design and project management tools.

BMC has a strong orderbook with and excellent client base and is in a significant growth phase, both domestically and in export markets.

As a result we are currently hiring design engineers to join our expanding team**.**

**Position**

Reporting to the Engineering Director, this position presents an excellent opportunity for a qualified professional in design engineering and the key project management functions of electrical switchgear production.

The successful candidate will be required to have technical knowledge, and an ability to project manage.

Attributes, such as team leadership and commercial awareness would be an advantage.

**Responsibilities**

Preparation of detailed design drawings and documentation in line with specifications

Identifying customer requirements

Researching suitable solutions and estimating costs and production schedules

Working to International (IEC), British (BS), European (EN), American (UL) and other standards

Commercial control of key projects including budgets and variations.

Liaising with key customers, sub-contractors and suppliers, including site surveys and meetings.

Project commercial controls including variations.

Monitoring products in use to improve on future design and liaise with R+D department for Product development

**Essential Qualifications & Experience**

Must have experience in a related position / comparable role involving exposure to switchgear design engineering and managing multiple ongoing projects

Bachelor of Engineering Degree (Electrical) an advantage

Project management skills

Aptitude for problem solving

An ability to respond to a fast-moving business environment

Accuracy and attention to detail

Oral and written presentation skills

Ability to work in cross functional teams

Training in Six Sigma or Design for Six Sigma is a plus.

You can look forward to a rewarding career, excellent package, collaborative working and opportunities to expand your skills in this fast moving, dynamic and agile business.

If you're a team player and we've just described your career aspirations, then please send your CV.

Are you a Junior Electrical Engineer in Electrical maintenance looking for a role within an exciting manufacturing environment where you will receive expert training on industrial printing machines and other cutting-edge equipment with the site team and external companies plus the chance to technically progress your career?

**The Role:**


You will be responsible for reactive and planned preventative maintenance on a range of electrical, and mechanical machinery put to use in a high-tech, fast moving, manufacturing environment. This role would suit a Junior Electrical Engineer with a background in machine maintenance looking for a role offering technical and engaging work, training on carton manufacturing equipment and career progression opportunities.  

  

**The Person:**

* Junior Electrical Engineer would suit recently graduated or 3rd or 4th apprentice electrician

* Or soon to be completed qualifications

 **Knowledge, skills experience**

* Experience in automated machinery ideally in a manufacturing environment.
* Good level of computer literacy,
* Methodical and ability to prioritise workload.
* Electrical and mechanical capabilities

  

Working hours for this role will be days Monday-Friday

Mission Statement: Technical lead for all engineering activities in assignments and responsible for the engineering department. Ensure that activities related to all engineering disciplines within the project are efficiently and cost-effectively executed in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards and safety requirements.

Provide technical support for tendering & Execution of Customer projects, preparation of Primary drawings & Bill of Quantities for Engineered items.
Technical lead for all projects.
Overall responsibility for managing and leading all engineering activities.
Instruct, supervise & coordinate engineering teams within internal & external partners and sub-suppliers.

Degree in Electrical Engineering.
10 years of experience in power systems engineering, in utility/industrial substations.

description:
Hitachi Energy has an exciting opportunity as a Senior Service Engineer you'll be joining the Grid Integration business reporting to the Country Service Solutions Manager.

This varied role will be based on various customer sites throughout Ireland and Northern Ireland joining a great team culture and a great working environment the encourages you to come as you are and take ownership of your own career with us here at Hitachi Energy.

As the new Senior Service Engineer we offer flexible working hours, overtime (over 40 hours) you will be expected to travel to customer sites when needed and will be required for significant maintenance tasks and on an impromptu basis main duties will include Installation Commissioning & Maintenance and Repair of the Hitachi Energy and similar manufacturers product portfolio

Responsibilities:

Provide technical support, repair and maintenance activity for customers and the team.

Ensure conformity to the Hitachi Energy Electrical Safety Management System.

Ensuring a strong relationship with our valued customers.

To maintain a safe working environment for all site employees & mitigate the risks.

Ensure ethical behaviours in line with Hitachi Energy code of conduct.

Maintain Maintenance Management System, complete all customer fault reports & commissioning documentation where required in a timely manner.

Manage the safety, electrical and environmental risks associated with the service business.

From time to time a requirement for short term travel outside Ireland to attend customer FAT and Commissioning.

Background:

Qualified Electrician with High Voltage Power Systems.

Knowledge of electrical industry, particularly High Voltage areas.

Relay programming/fault finding knowledge in control & protection.

Experience of one of, 38KV / 110KV or 220KV Equipment.

Background in the power sector service & maintenance would be desired.

Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc.

Knowledge of Hitachi Energy offerings of products and services would be ideal but not essential.

Self-motivated and able to thrive in a results-driven environment

description:
Hitachi Energy is a pioneering technology leader that is helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep the factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn from others. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation.

Hitachi Energy has an exciting opportunity for a Primary Electrical Engineer to support the Hitachi Energy Ireland Power Grids Grid Integration Business. The role reports to the Operations Manager and is responsible for electrical design works complying with Hitachi Energy and customer’s standards, procedures, and policies.

The role would be responsible for design authority for an engineering discipline with medium to high complexity. Coordinate engineering assignments across several different projects within the entire value chain efficiently, cost-effectively and in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards and safety requirements.

Mission Statement:

Lead all design engineering activities of a project to assure cost-effective engineering execution of project deliverables in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards, schedule, and safety requirements during the start-up, construction and/or erection, commissioning, maintenance phases.

Your responsibilities:

1. Technical contribution

Acts as a technical lead, approves design deliverables. Reviews all project documents for conformity and quality assurance. Anticipates and solves unprecedented problems, crucial issues and/or unique conditions. Serves as a specialist in the application of advanced concepts and methods.

2. Sales support

Assists in preparing proposal/presentation of engineering projects/programs (provision of bills of materials, estimated engineering hours, etc.).

3. Contract management

Supports Contract Managers in issuing claims (new/change in scope of work, cost impact, time impact, risk quantifications, etc.). Provides quality solutions as per customer requirement and delivers within budget and contract. Ensures adherence to safety standards and mitigates potential risks.

 4. Planning and control

Creates work plans and cost estimates in own area of responsibility Reviews and approves scope, budget and schedule for assignments and ensures quality deliverables on time and within targeted cost. Improves effectiveness of work plan in collaboration with other functions.

 5. Risk and opportunity management

Creates and executes strategies for risk and opportunity management in one’s area of responsibility. Identifies and manages contract risks taking corrective actions to resolve any contract/quality/program/cost issues. Reports any outstanding issues to management, along with recommendations for resolution.

 6. Customer

Works with the customer to shape and deliver solutions and seeks customer feedback to drive and deliver improvements. Attends project meetings and presents specific aspects of engineering assignments.

 7. Supply chain management

Collaborates with the Supply Chain function to ensure that technical requirements for equipment or services are communicated and agreed on with potential suppliers. Provides technical evaluation of supplier proposals and accepts as fit for purpose supplied equipment or services.

 8. Technical leadership and knowledge sharing

Represents function in standardization committees and in communication and conferences pertaining to broad aspects of engineering assignments. Acts as technical specialist/adviser to senior management. Collaborates and networks within Hitachi Energy and externally.

 9. Processes and tools

Reviews, develops and documents quality standards, processes, tools and techniques. Ensures that engineering activities comply with required safety regulations and contractual requirements. Contributes towards continuous improvements of processes and tools for engineering efficiency.

Basic Info

Job type Full time
Experience Experienced
Job function Engineering & Science
Contract Regular

Excellent English skills

description:
**Why work for us:**
--------------------


At Vodafone, we’re working hard to build a better future A more connected, more inclusive, and more sustainable world. We believe technology is only as powerful as the people using it to create a better tomorrow:

**Role Purpose:**
-----------------


The primary role of the Network Customer Engineer will be:  

Deliver Customer centric services based on Vodafone Business products and services.  

Deliver Vodafone Business services as contracted to Vodafone Business customers.  

To produce and publish low level technical designs / implementation guidelines and install these solutions as contracted with the customer to best practice standards.  

Work closely with the Projects, Configuration and Integration teams and Enterprise Services Operations to ensure all technical documentation and knowledge transfer is completed before handing over the solution for In-life support.  

Assist Presales teams in realising customer opportunities through the validation of solutions that utilise the products and services that exist within the Vodafone Business and Vodafone Product Portfolios.  

The Network Engineer will work closely with other members of the team, including those that exist within the Vodafone Business and the wider Enterprise and Vodafone teams. This will cover a range of disciplines i.e., Presale Team, Core Network Engineering, Operations, Product, Programmes & Projects, and Service and will ensure that the technology solution designed is fit for purpose and can be readily deployed and operated in a stable manner.  

The key deliverables for the Network Customer Engineer are to provide expert technical support to design, implement and assure the customers network and service availability.  

As required review / provide high-quality, technology solutions that have been approved by the customer and all internal stakeholders.  

The Network Engineer is responsible for creating the relevant documentation and deploying the solution to established standards before handing over for In-life support.

**Essence of Role – Key Accountabilities:**
-------------------------------------------

Has strong technical expertise in a broad area covering multiple technologies.  

Applies expected product behaviour across industry practices. Knows how the technology is expected to work in the industry.  

Peer review Pre Sales technical solutions ensuring that the solution design provides for a straight-forward deployment and meets the Enterprise Operational standards.  

Responsible for ensuring that all designs include an appropriate Enterprise network or solution management component to support monitoring, reporting and capacity planning.  

Responsible for defining and gaining sign off for low level technical design/ Implementation guides for contracted solution with the customer. (internal)  

Build and stage Network solutions for customer HQ, Distribution centres and branches in accordance to low level design documents.  

Support upgrading, implementation, deployment and go-live of agreed networks/Services to deliver agreed solution both inside and outside business hours as required.  

Adhere to Change Management Processes to ensure implementations are controlled and managed with minimal impact to both Vodafone and Customers networks and services.  

Provides systems/product training to internal stakeholders and customers.  

Responsible for providing in-depth troubleshooting expertise in all accountable Networks and Services.  

Collaborates with vendors on complex product hardware and software issues, driving resolution of defects.  

Work with cross-functional teams to resolve major customer issues as and when required.  

Proactive problem identification and resolution.  

Participate in on-call rota and provide expert assistance to on-call support specialists.  

Provide inputs to Network Problem Resolution and Root-Cause Analysis statements.  

Receives minimal supervision, no instruction on routine work, and general instructions on new assignments.

**We Are Looking for You If You Have:**
---------------------------------------


Proven track record of building and delivering customer solutions to agreed scheduled timelines.  

Demonstrated excellence in customer interaction, written and verbal communication.  

Expert knowledge of WAN/LAN design and Routing/Switching/forwarding protocols.  

Experience of contributing during Pre-Sales/bid phases  

Ability to priorities and manage internal and external stakeholder to handle multiple projects simultaneously.

  

Technical / Professional Expertise:  

Strong grasp of Aruba technologies (essential)  

Aruba Wireless experience (essential)  

Aruba Clearpass experience (essential)  

Aruba Certified Mobility Associate or Professional (ACMA / ACMP) (desirable)  

IMC / Aruba Airwave /Aruba Central experience (highly desirable)  

HP certification to Master ASE certification or Aruba ACSP (desirable)  

Cisco certification level to CCNP (desirable)  

Strong grasp of Firewall technologies (Cisco ASA, Palo Alto) (desirable)  

Ability to build strong internal / external relationships with key stakeholders.

  

Customer Focus:  

Engineering Professional with 4 + years’ experience preferably in a large complex environment  

Strong communication/influencing skills.  

Ability to demonstrate Problem Solving, Analytical thinking and Decision with virtual making  

Willing to master new technologies in line with the customer requirements

  

Communication;  

Demonstrate strong communication skills and ability to tailor communication and interaction style to different audiences.  

Act as a strong influencer across the team and wider business with a view to continuous improvement of process and customer experience

**Who we are:**
---------------


Vodafone is pioneering Ireland's gigabit society. We are Ireland's leading total communications provider offering products and services make a real impact in the lives and communities of our customers. As part of Vodafone Group, we are part of the world's largest mobile community with a presence across all five continents.


We’re at the forefront of innovation in Ireland. From delivering Gigabit speeds which offers the fastest game play for gamers, or helping people work from anywhere in the country, the work we do is at the cutting edge of technology and is constantly evolving.  

Our purpose is to connect for a better future, and this is made possible by our people. No matter what your background, career stage or interests, we have opportunities across all areas of the business, which will help you explore and unlock your full potential. You will get to work in a fantastic environment where diversity and difference is valued, flexible working is the norm and you’ll get to play a role in delivering Ireland’s Gigabit Society!  

Our people are at the centre of everything we do. We employ approximately 1,300 people in Dublin and across our network of retail stores in Ireland. Our aim is to ensure each employee has the opportunity to innovate, to be challenged and to be rewarded. We are dynamic in everything we do, including our approach to training, development, performance management and flexible benefits.  

Vodafone is committed to support LGBT+ people at work.  

We are an equal opportunities employer where our people can be at their best.

**When choosing us……….**
------------------------


When you join the Vodafone Team, you will have the chance to grow your career while also experiencing some serious benefits!


Some of the benefits that you will receive along the way are:  

Competitive Salary  

Flexible working (times and location) is part of our culture where your hours can facilitate your personal work-life balance  

Generous Employer Pension contribution  

Free Phone Bill – When you join the team, your phone bill is on us! You will also receive mobile phone purchasing discounts  

Learning and Development – We provide extensive training to all of our employees so they can progress in their careers! There is also the Vodafone University where our employees can gain incredible skills!  

Exclusive Family and Friends Discounts – Receive additional discounts for you, your Family and Friends on Vodafone Products!  

23 days annual leave and 3 charity days off – PLUS a dedicated day off for your birthday  

Free Parking  

Access to our Wellness centre including free access to our Gym, health and wellness centre and external practitioners


We are passionate about our employees! Here at Vodafone we want you to bring your whole self to work and we enable this with our progressive workplace policies. We are proud supporters of the LGBTQ+ community and Vodafone is committed to support all of their employees at work. We are an equal opportunities employers where our people can be at their best.


When you combine Technology and the human spirit, anything is possible. And when you join Vodafone, we’ll help you shape a rewarding career that gives back in more ways than one. Its starts here. It starts with you.


#LI-JB1 #LI-Hybrid

company_object.name: Vodafone
company_object.long_description:
At Vodafone, we are known for our technology, but the truth is, it is humanity that drives our business forward. With the global pandemic raising so many questions for tech brands, it has highlighted the leading role that we need to play.

We believe that, when working together, humanity and technology can find the answers and create a better future for all. 

Working at Vodafone is all about helping people feel ready to benefit from new technology. We bring the future to even the most remote places, using technology to help families in disaster zones, showing young people that a phone is not just for fun and thinking about technology that doesn’t even exist yet. 

More than 35 years ago, we made the first-ever mobile phone call, we sent the first SMS in Britain and have been changing the lives of billions of people ever since. Now, we are using smartphones to fight cancer, big data for social good, and we aim to connect over 250 million people to our next generation networks by 2025.

We are passionate about building a workplace where you can truly be yourself, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive and make a real difference to people and our planet. We are known for our technology, but it is humanity that drives us forward. What are you passionate about?

#TogetherWeCan

description:
**Why Vodafone Business?**
--------------------------

* As customers continue to invest in digital to capture productivity and growth in Ireland, we are embarking on a journey of transformation.
* This is an exciting time to join Vodafone Business as we are helping customers achieve their business ambitions through our expanding portfolio of ICT solutions and services across connectivity, cloud and security, managed services, SD-WAN, unified comms, collaboration and IoT.
* With our global reach and local expertise, we are empowering businesses of all sizes to grow and thrive.
* At the heart of this is developing best in class marketing and sales strategies to achieve our ambition to be the connectivity and digital champion, winning customers trust every day.
**Role Purpose:**
-----------------

* Mobility and IOT are key strategic product portfolios in Vodafone underpinning our Mobility and IOT revenues. As the Mobility & IOT Product Manager, you will be responsible for managing existing and developing new Mobility and IOT Products for Vodafone Business.
* You will do this by managing some of our existing Mobility and IOT Portfolio which includes products such Mobile Private Networks, Managed Mobility, Mobile Security, Device Lifecycle Management and IOT End to End solutions and IOT Connectivity.
* You will also be working with our Group Product teams to identity new Product opportunities in your portfolio and launch new Mobility and IOT products to help scale Vodafone’s business.
* The role in our Product Management team is Growth focused and the successful candidate needs excellent presentation, persuasion, and development skills, as well as the ability to position Vodafone and our go-to-market strategy to C-Level executives.
* You will be working with an existing set of Mobility and IOT Products that you will help to grow existing revenue.
* The role will identify new Mobility and IOT Product opportunities, jointly creating business plans with our Sales and Go to Market teams. You will be using the Vodafone Product Development Processes to launch these into the market.
* In the role you will work with our existing Mobility and IOT Product Managers on the portfolio working in a team environment where you will be supported and developed in your role.
* You will also work closely with our Partner Management teams who own strategic third-party relationships that may be part of products you manage or are building.
* Mobility and IOT is one of our highest growth areas and very strategic for our business as we develop our digital channels, and we are looking for an experienced and driven individual to drive this Portfolio.
* You will have ample opportunity to influence how the Mobility and IOT portfolio is developed and to influence and guide senior leadership in Vodafone Business on your SaaS Product Strategy.
* It is a strategic role and a proven launch pad for senior management careers in Vodafone.
**Essence of Role – Key Accountabilities:**
-------------------------------------------

* Deliver new products and manage in-life products in the Mobility and IOT Product Portfolios using the Vodafone Product Operating Model Methodology to optimise product performance, capability, and commercials, initiating resolving actions where necessary.
* Driving product strategy (~3-year horizon) in line with local market requirements and Group Product Strategy
* Is accountable for the commercial success of their products.
* Capture and translate local customer needs into clear product capabilities and features or to improve performance of existing products.
* Inputs into the VBU Product Roadmap, ensuring alignment with other Product Managers.
* Works with the Sales, Commercial, Go To Market and operational teams to ensure all go-to-market and launch requirements are consistent, scalable and aligned.
* Drives a clear sales strategy and operational plan with key partners. Where assigned works with the Strategic Partnership team to leverage all partner programs and promotion offers to drive SaaS sales
* Drives product success through product differentiation, value-add & execution strategies to underpin their product’s success.
* Work closely with our Strategic Partner Management team to identify new partners to accelerate speed to market for IOT End to End Solutions.
* Drives product success through product differentiation, value-add & execution strategies to underpin product’s success.
**Who you are:**
----------------

* 5-10 years’ experience in Product Management including experience in developing, proving, and selling the customer business case.
* Proven experience with Mobility and IOT Products working with Sales, Product Development, Care, Digital and IT Teams
* Project Management Skills

**Professional, proven & senior competence in:**

* building relationships with key stakeholders in Sales, IT, Care, Partners, Build and Commercial
* being the key connection between the market requirements and the business resources.
* creating business and go-to-market plans with and ensuring that they are executed.
* Excellent communication and persuasive skills in English, both written and verbal
* Able to work independently and autonomously in a newly launched go-to-market setting.
* Comfortable working in an organization based on trust and openness – being empowered to speak up and every day try to improve how we work and how we put customers first.
* Negotiating skills and ability to influence.
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required.
**Who we are:**
---------------

* Vodafone is pioneering Ireland's Gigabit society.
* We are Ireland's leading total communications provider offering products and services make a real impact in the lives and communities of our customers.
* As part of Vodafone Group, we are part of the world's largest mobile community with a presence across all five continents.
* We’re at the forefront of innovation in Ireland. From delivering Gigabit speeds which offers the fastest game play for gamers, or helping people work from anywhere in the country, the work we do is at the cutting edge of technology and is constantly evolving.
* Our purpose is to connect for a better future, and this is made possible by our people.
* No matter what your background, career stage or interests, we have opportunities across all areas of the business, which will help you explore and unlock your full potential.
* You will get to work in a fantastic environment where diversity and difference is valued, flexible working is the norm and you’ll get to play a role in delivering Ireland’s Gigabit Society!
* Our people are at the centre of everything we do. We employ approximately 1,300 people in Dublin and across our network of retail stores in Ireland.
* Our aim is to ensure each employee has the opportunity to innovate, to be challenged and to be rewarded. We are dynamic in everything we do, including our approach to training, development, performance management and flexible benefits.
* Vodafone is committed to support LGBT+ people at work.
* We are an equal opportunities employer where our people can be at their best.
**When choosing us……….**
------------------------


When you join the Vodafone Team, you will have the chance to grow your career while also experiencing some serious benefits!

**Some of the benefits that you will receive along the way are:**

* Competitive Salary
* Flexible working (times and location) is part of our culture where your hours can facilitate your personal work-life balance
* Generous Employer Pension contribution
* Free Phone Bill – When you join the team, your phone bill is on us! You will also receive mobile phone purchasing discounts
* Learning and Development – We provide extensive training to all of our employees so they can progress in their careers! There is also the Vodafone University where our employees can gain incredible skills!
* Exclusive Family and Friends Discounts – Receive additional discounts for you, your Family and Friends on Vodafone Products!
* 23 days annual leave and 3 charity days off – PLUS a dedicated day off for your birthday
* Free Parking
* Access to our Wellness Centre including free access to our Gym, health and wellness Centre and external Practitioners.
**Long Description**
--------------------

* We are passionate about our employees! Here at Vodafone we want you to bring your whole self to work and we enable this with our progressive workplace policies.
* We are proud supporters of the LGBTQ+ community and Vodafone is committed to support all of their employees at work. We are an equal opportunities employers where our people can be at their best.
* When you combine Technology and the human spirit, anything is possible.
* And when you join Vodafone, we’ll help you shape a rewarding career that gives back in more ways than one.
* It starts here. It starts with you.

company_object.name: Vodafone
company_object.long_description:
At Vodafone, we are known for our technology, but the truth is, it is humanity that drives our business forward. With the global pandemic raising so many questions for tech brands, it has highlighted the leading role that we need to play.

We believe that, when working together, humanity and technology can find the answers and create a better future for all. 

Working at Vodafone is all about helping people feel ready to benefit from new technology. We bring the future to even the most remote places, using technology to help families in disaster zones, showing young people that a phone is not just for fun and thinking about technology that doesn’t even exist yet. 

More than 35 years ago, we made the first-ever mobile phone call, we sent the first SMS in Britain and have been changing the lives of billions of people ever since. Now, we are using smartphones to fight cancer, big data for social good, and we aim to connect over 250 million people to our next generation networks by 2025.

We are passionate about building a workplace where you can truly be yourself, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive and make a real difference to people and our planet. We are known for our technology, but it is humanity that drives us forward. What are you passionate about?

#TogetherWeCan

The engineer will also lead the delivery cycle of the above (LLD, Coordination of activities to bring the project into reality), will coordinate the Lifecycle Management of the platform and will observe and monitor resiliency, performance and capacity management of the IP Core Network

job_title: DevSecOps Lead - Product Development - Information Security
description:
Why work for us:

At Vodafone, we’re working hard to build a better future A more connected, more inclusive, and more sustainable world. We believe technology is only as powerful as the people using it to create a better tomorrow:

Role Purpose:

Vodafone Ireland is changing rapidly and introducing scaled agile-based development across the organisation. As part of it, DevSecOps is getting the standard way of working, and security will be part of the daily agile routines. The DevSecOps teams are developing, implementing, and maintaining IT systems. They are incorporating principles and engineering secure systems from the outset and throughout the lifecycle to reduce vulnerabilities and increase the speed of development. The Information Security Lead or Security Chapter Lead acts in the DevSecOps era, coaches security team leads (Security Champions), and helps them gain practical understanding and knowledge about security prioritization and management within product and service delivery within their development area. The Security Chapter Lead empowers Security Champions to make Security decisions within their responsibility area, and makes them accountable for their decision

Essence of Role – Key Accountabilities:

Act as a full-time Security expert in Cyber Security Ireland
Act as the Security single point of contact for developers and lead engineers
Develop the Security Champions model and the local Security community, championing security best practice and standards
Coach the Product Owner, the Scrum Master and all team members on the importance of Security requirements
Support product and service development with Secure by Design expertise
Lead Security Champions, act as the Security SPOC for them and implement the Secure Agile Development Standard
Identify opportunities to automate security tasks to increase efficiency
Alert on Security incidents that the Security Champions bring to their attention and follow Vodafone Standards for reporting
Report on risk and compliance levels for relevant products and services in the responsibility area
Define Secure by Design blueprints, patterns, and design principles to support product and service development
Give recommendation on mitigation strategies for vulnerabilities or weaknesses in products or services
Contribute to security user stories and create security blueprints and design principles

We Are Looking For You, If You Have:

Essential
Experience working in an agile and/or DevOps/DevSecOps environment
Experience working in an enterprise development environment as a security representative
Experience with CI/CD pipelines
IT Security background and IT architecture experience
Broad security knowledge and practical experience in designing risk-oriented security solutions with a strong focus on Cloud-based deployments (AWS, GCP)
A diverse security background with knowledge in several areas, including layered security architecture, internet protocols, API security, mobile and web applications security, VPN, firewalls, WAF, IDPS risk and vulnerability assessments, and compliance
Proven experience participating in multiple security programs, projects, and initiatives
Ability to think strategically and drive change
Ability to build and manage teams, motivate team members
Ability to work under time and resource pressure
Ability to work with people remotely who are in different geo locations

At Vodafone, we’re working hard to build a better future a more connected, more inclusive, and more sustainable world. We believe technology is only as powerful as the people using it to create a better tomorrow.

Role Purpose:

Business Service Operations (BSO) sits in the Commercial Operations business unit. Your colleagues specialise in supporting complex Voice and Data solutions (WAN, LAN, SDx, WIFI, UC) for our Corporate and Government customer base.
The 2nd Level Support Network Engineer is a customer-focused, operational person. Your core function is providing 2nd level of network support to our managed service business customers across a wide range of Vodafone products and services. You will work on more complex faults than your 1st level support colleagues.
You are a strong standout colleague with a focus on delivering a first-class service to our customers. You are passionate about networking and technology. You have previous experience in supporting Aruba LAN, Wi-Fi, SDx and Cisco networks within a technical function. You are a complex problem solver who uses critical thinking and creativity to troubleshoot and resolve complex customer incidents, all the time working with the customer directly.
You will complete important follow up problem management and continuous service improvement (CSI) activities on the back of an incident.
You will liaise between Network Operations, Commercial Operations, Technical Design, 3rd Line Engineering, 3rd Party partners, suppliers and carriers communicating between all key stakeholders to ensure resolution of faults.

Essence of Role – Key Accountabilities:

As a BSO 2nd Level Support Engineer you will:
• Work as part of a managed service team
• Provide a highly professional second level support, triage, and resolution of incidents
• Communicate with customers of a technical nature in a clear and concise manner
• Demonstrate customer focus and an understanding of a customer’s needs
• Build trusted relationship with our customers, by driving continuous service improvement and managing escalations
• Take ownership of incidents, communication, and partner engagement for complex & critical incidents, using your understanding of customer networks and solutions
• Clearly escalate incidents and problems internally within Vodafone and with external parties where required
• Prioritise incidents as per the Incident Management Process Priority Matrix
• Act as a subject matter expert on the Vodafone Product Portfolio
• Act as tech lead for projects e.g. Service launch, early life support, tooling, process, documentation
• Interpret trends in incidents, problems and network behavior and communicate this trend to other areas
• Change management, prepare, and implement change requests under governance

Essential
• A minimum of 5 years’ experience in supporting complex telecommunication and CPE (customer premise equipment) based propositions within a technical function of CPE vendor, TELCO, or large organization.
• Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification
• Aruba Certified Mobility Associate (ACMA), Aruba Certified Switching Associate (ACSA), Aruba Certified ClearPass Associate (ACCA) certifications
• Hands on experience in Aruba/Meraki SD, Wi-Fi, and LAN
• iMC / Aruba Airwave / Aruba Central / Aruba Clearpass experience
• Strong technical knowledge of technology and subject matter expert in WAN; LAN; Wi-Fi; SDx; Network Security
• Complex problem solver
• Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills
• Self-motivated and energetic worker
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to react well to pressure

• Degree in IT / Telecommunications / Engineering

description:
Why work for us:

At Vodafone, we’re working hard to build a better future A more connected, more inclusive, and more sustainable world. We believe technology is only as powerful as the people using it to create a better tomorrow:

Role Purpose:

The FTTH Commercial Product Owner is a key member of the Consumer Fixed Marketing team, taking specific ownership and responsibility for the development, delivery and success of our FTTH ambitions. The FTTH Commercial Product owner is very much seen as the Consumer SPOC (Single Point of Contact), internally and externally, with detailed knowledge of the technology’s functional benefits and key business processes across Acquisition, Installation and in-life management. This role takes overall responsibility for getting maximum value from the rollout of FTTH across Ireland including Rollout Planning, achieving Sales/Commercial Success and integrity of end-to-end Customer experience.

Key Responsibilities for this role:

Strategic planning for FTTH Acquisition and Migration activities:
Co-ordinate with internal and external stakeholders/data sets, Vodafone’s approach to exploiting the FTTH rollout across Ireland and ensuring our success on both new customer acquisition but also how we migrate our existing legacy technology customer. Lead and own the choice of locations and roll out strategy identifying and verifying key success factors
Identify new and compelling ways of offering FTTH services and contribute creative ideas for the development and promotion of the FTTH proposition
Act as a Consumer SPOC for all negotiations and relationships with third party providers ensuring the best interests of Vodafone Ireland are met

Channel alignment, GTM readiness and Tactical Support:
Crucial to this role will be listening to feedback from our Sales Channels to understand how we continue to improve, adapt and win in the market.

Essential
5+ years Marketing Experience
Excellent analytical skills

Demonstratable experience of working cross-functionally
Presence and credibility communicating at leadership level across markets
Knowledge in customer analytics and experience blending data and customer insights to drive action.
Excellent communications and presentation skills
Ability to understand issues at both operational and strategic levels and to influence stakeholders to action

Desirable
Strong understanding of telecommunications industry, specifically FTTH technology, is preferred
Experience running major marketing activity with significant budgets would be a major advantage

Who we are:

Vodafone is pioneering Ireland's gigabit society. We are Ireland's leading total communications provider offering products and services make a real impact in the lives and communities of our customers. As part of Vodafone Group, we are part of the world's largest mobile community with a presence across all five continents.

We’re at the forefront of innovation in Ireland. From delivering Gigabit speeds which offers the fastest game play for gamers, or helping people work from anywhere in the country, the work we do is at the cutting edge of technology and is constantly evolving.
Our purpose is to connect for a better future, and this is made possible by our people. Our people are at the centre of everything we do. We employ approximately 1,300 people in Dublin and across our network of retail stores in Ireland. Our aim is to ensure each employee has the opportunity to innovate, to be challenged and to be rewarded. We are dynamic in everything we do, including our approach to training, development, performance management and flexible benefits.

We are an equal opportunities employer where our people can be at their best.

Competitive Salary

company_object.long_description:
At Vodafone, we are known for our technology, but the truth is, it is humanity that drives our business forward. With the global pandemic raising so many questions for tech brands, it has highlighted the leading role that we need to play.

We believe that, when working together, humanity and technology can find the answers and create a better future for all. 

Working at Vodafone is all about helping people feel ready to benefit from new technology. We bring the future to even the most remote places, using technology to help families in disaster zones, showing young people that a phone is not just for fun and thinking about technology that doesn’t even exist yet. 

More than 35 years ago, we made the first-ever mobile phone call, we sent the first SMS in Britain and have been changing the lives of billions of people ever since. Now, we are using smartphones to fight cancer, big data for social good, and we aim to connect over 250 million people to our next generation networks by 2025.

We are passionate about building a workplace where you can truly be yourself, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive and make a real difference to people and our planet. We are known for our technology, but it is humanity that drives us forward. What are you passionate about?

#TogetherWeCan

description:
Why Vodafone Business?
As customers continue to invest in digital to capture productivity and growth in Ireland, we are embarking on a journey of transformation.
This is an exciting time to join Vodafone Business as we are helping customers achieve their business ambitions through our expanding portfolio of ICT solutions and services across connectivity, cloud and security, managed services, SD-WAN, unified comms, collaboration and IoT.
With our global reach and local expertise, we are empowering businesses of all sizes to grow and thrive. At the heart of this is developing best in class marketing and sales strategies to achieve our ambition to be the connectivity and digital champion, winning customers trust every day.
Role Purpose:
We are currently looking to hire 2 SaaS Product Managers. As the SaaS Product Manager, you will be responsible for managing existing and developing new SaaS Products for Vodafone business.
You will do this by managing our existing SaaS Portfolio which includes products such as Microsoft O365, Trend Micro, Lookout and others and working with our Group Product and Marketplace teams to launch new SaaS products to help scale Vodafone’s business.
The role in our Product Management team is Growth focused and the successful candidate needs excellent presentation, persuasion and development skills, as well as the ability to position Vodafone and our go-to-market strategy to C-Level executives.
You will be working with an existing set of SaaS Products that you will help to grow existing revenues while identifying new SaaS Product opportunities, jointly creating business plans with our Sales and Go to Market teams and using the Vodafone Product Development Processes to launch these into the market.
Vodafone have a Marketplace platform that underpins our sale and in-life management of our SaaS Products that is critical to our Digital Strategy, and you will work closely with our local and group Marketplace teams.
SaaS is one of our highest growth areas and very strategic for our business as we develop our digital channels, and we are looking for an experienced and driven individual to drive this Portfolio.
You will have ample opportunity to influence how the SaaS portfolio is developed and to influence and guide senior leadership in Vodafone Business on your SaaS Product Strategy.
Essence of Role – Key Accountabilities:
Deliver new SaaS products and manage in-life products using the Vodafone Product Operating Model Methodology to optimise product performance, capability, and commercials, initiating resolving actions where necessary.
Driving product strategy (~3-year horizon) in line with local market requirements and Group Product Strategy
Is accountable for the commercial success of their products.
Capture and translate local SaaS customer needs into clear product capabilities and features or to optimise existing products.
Inputs into the VBU Product Roadmap, ensuring alignment with other Product Managers and developing cross portfolio propositions.
Works with the Sales, Commercial, Go to Market and operational teams to ensure all go-to-market and launch requirements are consistent, scalable and aligned.
Drives a clear sales strategy and operational plan with key partners. Where assigned works with the Strategic Partnership team to leverage all partner programs and promotion offers to drive SaaS sales.
Drives product success through product differentiation, value-add & execution strategies to underpin product’s success.
We Are Looking For You,If You Have:
5+ years SaaS Product Management Experience
Proven experience with SaaS Products working with Sales, Product Development, Digital and IT Teams
Project Management Skills
Professional, proven & senior competence in:

 - building relationships with key stakeholders in Sales, IT, Care, Partners, Build and Commercial

 - being the key connection between Group Product and the local Market

 - creating business and go-to-market plans with and ensuring that they are executed.

Excellent communication and persuasive skills in English, both written and verbal
Able to work independently and autonomously in a newly launched go-to-market setting.
Comfortable working in an organization based on trust and openness – being empowered to speak up and every day try to improve how we work and how we put customers first.
Negotiating skills and ability to influence.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required.

Why work for us:

At Vodafone, we’re working hard to build a better future a more connected, more inclusive, and more sustainable world. We believe technology is only as powerful as the people using it to create a better tomorrow.

Role Purpose:

Business Service Operations (BSO) sits in the Commercial Operations business unit. Your colleagues specialise in supporting complex Voice and Data solutions (WAN, LAN, SDx, WIFI, UC) for our Corporate and Government customer base.
The 2nd Level Support Network Engineer is a customer-focused, operational person. Your core function is providing 2nd level of network support to our managed service business customers across a wide range of Vodafone products and services. You will work on more complex faults than your 1st level support colleagues.
You are a strong standout colleague with a focus on delivering a first-class service to our customers. You are passionate about networking and technology. You have previous experience in supporting Aruba LAN, Wi-Fi, SDx and Cisco networks within a technical function. You are a complex problem solver who uses critical thinking and creativity to troubleshoot and resolve complex customer incidents, all the time working with the customer directly.
You will complete important follow up problem management and continuous service improvement (CSI) activities on the back of an incident.
You will liaise between Network Operations, Commercial Operations, Technical Design, 3rd Line Engineering, 3rd Party partners, suppliers and carriers communicating between all key stakeholders to ensure resolution of faults.

Essence of Role – Key Accountabilities:

As a BSO 2nd Level Support Engineer you will:
• Work as part of a managed service team
• Provide a highly professional second level support, triage, and resolution of incidents
• Communicate with customers of a technical nature in a clear and concise manner
• Demonstrate customer focus and an understanding of a customer’s needs
• Build trusted relationship with our customers, by driving continuous service improvement and managing escalations
• Take ownership of incidents, communication, and partner engagement for complex & critical incidents, using your understanding of customer networks and solutions
• Clearly escalate incidents and problems internally within Vodafone and with external parties where required
• Prioritise incidents as per the Incident Management Process Priority Matrix
• Act as a subject matter expert on the Vodafone Product Portfolio
• Act as tech lead for projects e.g. Service launch, early life support, tooling, process, documentation
• Interpret trends in incidents, problems and network behavior and communicate this trend to other areas
• Change management, prepare, and implement change requests under governance

We Are Looking For You, If You Have:

Essential
• A minimum of 5 years’ experience in supporting complex telecommunication and CPE (customer premise equipment) based propositions within a technical function of CPE vendor, TELCO, or large organization.
• Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification
• Aruba Certified Mobility Associate (ACMA), Aruba Certified Switching Associate (ACSA), Aruba Certified ClearPass Associate (ACCA) certifications
• Hands on experience in Aruba/Meraki SD, Wi-Fi, and LAN
• iMC / Aruba Airwave / Aruba Central / Aruba Clearpass experience
• Strong technical knowledge of technology and subject matter expert in WAN; LAN; Wi-Fi; SDx; Network Security
• Complex problem solver
• Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills
• Self-motivated and energetic worker
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to react well to pressure

Desirable
• Degree in IT / Telecommunications / Engineering
• Knowledge of Vodafone Business Corporate product portfolio

company_object.name: Vodafone
company_object.long_description:
At Vodafone, we are known for our technology, but the truth is, it is humanity that drives our business forward. With the global pandemic raising so many questions for tech brands, it has highlighted the leading role that we need to play.

We believe that, when working together, humanity and technology can find the answers and create a better future for all. 

Working at Vodafone is all about helping people feel ready to benefit from new technology. We bring the future to even the most remote places, using technology to help families in disaster zones, showing young people that a phone is not just for fun and thinking about technology that doesn’t even exist yet. 

More than 35 years ago, we made the first-ever mobile phone call, we sent the first SMS in Britain and have been changing the lives of billions of people ever since. Now, we are using smartphones to fight cancer, big data for social good, and we aim to connect over 250 million people to our next generation networks by 2025.

We are passionate about building a workplace where you can truly be yourself, share inspiration, embrace new opportunities, thrive and make a real difference to people and our planet. We are known for our technology, but it is humanity that drives us forward. What are you passionate about?

#TogetherWeCan

description:
*Job description *

*Kiernan Engineering* requires Electrical Project Engineers for Large Scale Projects in the

Cork and Munster Regions.

*Role/Responsibilities. *
* Provide Technical Support to the project team
* Manage the Electrical document control to ensure that all relevant logs are kept up to date at all times
* Develop a designer’s systems functional description documentation from design intent to final implementation document
* Create and develop handover packs and test packs for Electrical and Instrumentation systems from the agreed systems list and create the system boundaries
* Manage the systems turnover packs with the client’s commission teams
* Attend quality meetings and participate in QA/QC walk-downs when required
* Evaluate the RFI responses to ensure that there are no engineering issues with them
* Preparing all technical submittals according to specifications
* Develop and monitor all cable schedules throughout the project, such as MV, LV,

Control, ELV, EMS, BMS, ICT, Fibre, Security, F.A., and F.S., ensuring there are no omissions
* Prepare O&M documentation for all systems
* Review and answer technical queries from the site concerning specifications/drawings/materials/equipment and closeout.
* Work as an integral part of the commissioning process and sign-off commissioning parameters
* Ensure all document control is updated regularly as required in both hard and soft copy
* Ensure site supervisors are working off the latest drawings at all times and assist in the engineering development of supervisors

* Develop and generate all the required sign-off documentation for systems
* Ensure the Quality plan is relevant and modify it accordingly
* Carry out lighting calculations, design reviews, LV cable sizing
* Assist with the development of a commissioning strategy and implementation.
* Ensuring checks are completed for compliance with the latest regulations and relevant design codes

*Requirements.* o Relevant Third Level qualification or proven track record of delivering large-scale projects in a challenging environment. o Trade Background preferred but not essential. o Contracting Experience and Experience dealing with and administrating construction work in line with contract requirements. o Self-starter is promoting positive work culture with a team focus. o, Experience working with multi-functional teams/departments. o Excellent I.T. Skills and Communication skills are essential.

*Salary will be negotiable based on qualifications and Experience.*

*About Us.*

Kiernan Engineering is a Munster-based Electrical & Instrumentation Contracting Company and, since its formation in 1993, has earned a reputation for delivering High-Quality

Installations to our customer base.

We pride ourselves in working in partnership with many of our client base since our inception and will endeavour to grow these partnerships in a safe and collaborative work environment.

Our company has successfully completed a wide range of Projects in the Industrial,

Pharmaceutical, Petro Chemical, Commercial, Education and Medical Sectors of our

Industry.

Kiernan Engineering operates to the strictest of Safety Standards, with us achieving a SAFE

T (A Grade) rating. All employees have a minimum of Safe Pass, Kiernan Safety Induction

Program and ATEX Hazardous Area Training Program. Ongoing Training is an integral part of our Safety Policy.

We also operate to the highest Quality Standards, where our company’s quality management system is accredited with I.S. EN ISO 9001:2015.

description:
Glanbia Business Services
  
  

Join this dynamic team focused on delivering better nutrition for every step of life’s journey
  
  

The Opportunity
  
A vacancy has arisen for the role of SAP Basis Support Engineer at Glanbia Business Services. This is a permanent position & will report to the Application Technology Manager.
  
  

Glanbia plc operates a world-class Business Applications suite comprising SAP and other Enterprise class solutions , both on premise and cloud based , to support the business in reaching its objectives. The SAP Basis Support Engineer will be part of the team responsible for the on-going design and support of IT enabled solutions for the global business.
  
  

Participate in the Technical Administration, Integration & Support (Netweaver/Basis) for the group SAP eco-system both on-premise and Cloud based (hybrid)
  
Participate in the Technical Administration & Support of the group non-SAP systems
  
Support of the in-house Application Development, Glanbia Business Services Centres of Excellence and Business Application Support Teams.
  
Working with the wider Technical Teams to deliver additional functionality / components as required by the Business.
  
P articipate in the design of the ongoing evolution of the on premise solution landscape which will also encompass SAP Analytics Cloud , Datasphere , C4C , BTP , CPI etc
  
  

The skills you will bring to the team
  
Third level qualification in Computing/Information Technology or equivalent
  
3+ years SAP NetWeaver Administration experience or equivalent enterprise class system administration/DBA experience
  
Proficiency in one or more SAP technologies (Eg ECC, S/4Hana, BW, BO, C4C, BTP ) would be an advantage
  
Experience in cloud technologies/integration desirable
  
Exposure to planning, design, installation, and technical configuration of SAP components
  
Strong technical aptitude
  
  

Where & how you will work
  
The base location of the role will be Kilkenny or Dublin 24, with a hybrid working arrangement available through our Smart working model which allows you a greater choice in how you work and live, giving you a better work-life balance.
  
  

What we would like to offer you!
  
The opportunity to develop your career on a global stage, continuous learning through an on-demand learning platform, and a competitive compensation package including staff discounts
  
About Glanbia
  
**The Glanbia Group comprises three divisions:** Glanbia Performance Nutrition , Glanbia Nutritional's, and Joint Ventures . Collectively and with our partners we offer an incredible breadth of expertise in nutrition. We employ a team of 6,000 people, work with global food and beverage companies, and sell our award-winning and market-leading products in 130 countries worldwide.
  
At Glanbia, we celebrate diversity, because we know that our individual strengths make us stronger together. We welcome and encourage interest from a variety of candidates, we will give your application consideration, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.
  
  

At Glanbia, our culture celebrates individuality, knowing that together we are more.

company_object.long_description:
Glanbia  is a better nutrition  company, helping  people  live  full,  healthy lives. We are a team  of scientists, innovators,  tastemakers, and  relationship-builders,  creating  better nutrition products and  more  sustainable  ways of  doing  business. 

Our  heritage  is in dairy, but we've  evolved  to become  a global  nutrition leader,  home  to brands  and ingredients  that help people  around  the world  perform  well, recover  quickly, and  stay strong, at any age. The future  of  food  is personal — we  continue to grow,  using insight-and science-led  innovation  to deliver  the high-quality  nutrition  our consumers  need. The  choices we  make every  day are  guided  by our purpose — we're  here  to help  people  live  their best, while  doing  better by each other  and the earth.

Responsibilities:
**SENIOR STAFF SILICON DESIGN ENGINEER**  

  

**T****HE ROLE****:**
This is an exciting opportunity to join the innovative and multi-award winning team that has developed the RF data converter sub-system, including direct-RF digital signal processing, around which Xilinx Zynq® Ultrascale+™ RFSoC is built. As part of the Analog and Digital-RF design group you will be working on leading-edge digital communications developments in a complex mixed-signal environment using the latest FinFET CMOS processes. We develop a wide rage of ultra-challenging, high instance count(1-5M), high speed (>1GHz), high utilization, mixed signal, low power digital IPs in highly collaborative and productive working environment, and will offer a highly competitive package to a suitable candidate.  

This is a leadership role within the design team responsible for the development of digital blocks in the RFSoC family of devices.  

  

**THE PERSON:**
A successful candidate will work as a key leader within the team.  

  

**K****EY RESPONSIBLITIES****:*** Architecture definition in consultation with product marketing
* Supervision and review of digital design, including specification, RTL coding, basic verification
* Interacting with analog team to define analog/digital interfaces and specification
* Collaboration with verification team to support verification planning, debug and coverage closure
* Interfacing to synthesis and place-and-route teams to discuss and resolve timing, power, and other issues
* Potentially people management of more junior engineers within the team

 **P****REFERRED EXPERIENCE****:*** Extensive knowledge and experience of digital IC design in a technical leadership position
* Experience of working in mixed-signal designs and interfacing between analog and digital domains
* Knowledge of digital signal processing techniques and algorithms
* Experience of optimisation of high performance datapaths for speed, power and area
* Knowledge of physical / synthesis considerations such as timing constraints and design for low power
* Familiarity with modern verification techniques such as UVM
* Experience of project management in a leadership position
* Keen interest in process improvement to enhance the efficiency of the team
* Interest in evaluating, developing and adopting AI initiatives in design flows and methodologies

 **ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:*** Bachelors or Masters degree in computer engineering/Electrical Engineering with at least 10 years' industry experience

 **LOCATION**

* Dublin or Cork
