Responsibilities:
**SILICON DESIGN ENGINEER**  

The AMD SerDes team in Ireland are hiring for an Analog Circuit Design Engineer to work on SerDes products up to 200+Gbps on the latest CMOS FinFET nodes. The AMD team have extensive experience in the design of circuits for the high speed transmission and recovery of data over wired links, including  

* High-speed data Converters for signal recovery(ADC) and transmit signal conditioning(DAC)
* Continuous Time Equalisers with programmable gain and B/W up to 60+GHz
* Wide-range, low-noise PLLs operating up to 20+GHz
* Injection Locked Oscillators for multi-phase clock generation
* High speed clock distribution and correction circuits
* Custom Digital circuits for data serialisation
* High-speed wired channel termination and driver circuits

  

The successful candidate will work with a world class team in the development of SerDes solutions to facilitate the future connectivity of AMD CPU , GPU and FPGA products. **The Role:**
The role requires the development of high-speed and high-performance analog circuits at the lowest power possible. The candidate would be expected to have extensive experience in the design and verification of analog circuits and systems, and be familiar with layout floor-planning, layout dependent effects and post-layout verification. **Day to day responsibilities:*** Design of analog circuits related to SerDes phy development to meet block level design specifications
* Verification of circuit designs to ensure functional, performance and reliability targets are achieved using industry standard tools and methodologies.
* Regular presentation and sharing of design progress to peers
* Participating in design reviews of other circuits both for identifying potential issues and also from a learning perspective.
* Communication with SerDes circuit team members at other sites for the purposes of sharing ideas.
* Feeding back circuit performance information to the architecture team for the purposes of system modelling.
* Support of the system level verification team in the modelling of analog circuits in Verilog and in the debug of identified issues
* Assist with silicon bring up and debug.

 **Preferred Experience:*** Good analog circuit design and analysis skills
* Experience with industry standard schematic entry and circuit simulation tools and methodologies
* Good programming / scripting skills
* Familiarity with the impact of layout effects on circuit design
* Experience with circuit floorplanning.
* Previous experience on high speed circuit design would be a benefit.
* Experience in silicon debug, verification and characterization
* Good interpersonal/teamwork skills

 **Academic Credentials:*** Honors BE (or equivalent) in Electrical / Electronic Engineering + 2Yrs
* MS

Job Description

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

THE ROLE:

AMD is looking for a Design Verification Engineer willing to take on the challenge of becoming part of the PCIe Sub-System Design Verification team. In this role you will be given an opportunity to work on the next generation technology that will be part of future AMD Microprocessors powering Gaming Consoles, Servers and Personal Computers as well as Graphics Cards and VR sets. This team is responsible for the Verification of several critical Sub-Systems as well as the integration of lower level IPs and the Sub-System delivery to SoC. The team is responsible for verifying a balanced architecture between power consumption and performance, delivering high complexity RTL code and Verification components, as well as creating advanced testbenches using leading-edge verification techniques.

THE PERSON:

A successful candidate will work with senior silicon design engineers. The candidate will be highly accurate and detail-oriented, possessing good communication and problem-solving skills.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with high-speed, low power digital circuit designs from definition to implementation
Verification of critical high speed digital designs using both coverage driven random and directed testing techniques as well as Formal verification.
Own some or all aspects of the Verification flow from initial test planning to coverage convergence and sign-off closure for one or more features and aspects of Sub-System level IP interoperability.
Building testbench components as well as developing test and sequence libraries, by applying Objected Oriented Programming Verification techniques following UVM methodology.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Strong background in ASIC Design Flow
Expertise in Design Verification
Proficient in SystemVerilog and scripting languages like Python, Perl, Ruby, Makefile, shell
Experience verifying complex designs using UVM, OVM or VMM
Proficient in debugging firmware and RTL code using simulation tools
Automating workflows in a distributed compute environment.
Familiarity with industry standard high-speed protocols such as PCIe, SATA, USB or Ethernet is a plus
Experience with verification of Hardware-Firmware interaction is highly desirable
Exposure to simulation profile, efficiency improvement, acceleration, HLS tools/process
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with pronounced attention to detail
Capable of independently driving tasks and activities to completion in an organized and timely manner with excellent quality

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:

Bachelors or Masters degree in computer engineering/Electrical Engineering

AMD is looking for a Design Verification Engineer willing to take on the challenge of becoming part of the PCIe Sub-System Design Verification team. The team is responsible for verifying a balanced architecture between power consumption and performance, delivering high complexity RTL code and Verification components, as well as creating advanced testbenches using leading-edge verification techniques.

THE PERSON:

A successful candidate will work with senior silicon design engineers. The candidate will be highly accurate and detail-oriented, possessing good communication and problem-solving skills.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Verification of critical high speed digital designs using both coverage driven random and directed testing techniques.
Work on various aspects of the Verification flow from initial test planning to coverage convergence and sign-off closure for one or more features and aspects of Sub-System level IP interoperability.
Assist in building testbench components as well as developing test and sequence libraries, by applying Objected Oriented Programming Verification techniques following UVM methodology.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Background in ASIC Design Flow
Experience in Design Verification
Proficient in SystemVerilog
Experience with scripting languages like Python, Perl, Ruby, Makefile, shell
Experience in debugging firmware and RTL code using simulation tools
Familiarity with automating workflows in a distributed compute environment.
Familiarity with industry standard high-speed protocols such as PCIe, SATA, USB or Ethernet
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with pronounced attention to detail

LOCATION: Cork or Dublin

ONSITE: This role requires the student to work onsite at the Cork or Dublin office throughout the duration of the Co-op/Intern term.

PROGRAM TERM: June 1st - August 31st 2024

OUR TEAM:

The AMD SerDes team in Ireland are recruiting for Intern positions for 2024. Come and learn about circuit design for SerDes products operating up to 200+Gbps on the latest CMOS FinFET nodes. The AMD team have extensive experience in the design of circuits for the high speed transmission and recovery of data over wired links. The successful candidate will learn from a world class team who deliver SerDes solutions to facilitate the future connectivity of AMD CPU, GPU and FPGA products.

THE ROLE:

We have roles available in both the analog and digital design spaces. If you are interested in learning about the development process for cutting edge silicon designs please apply.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

For those interested in learning Analog Design, the successful candidate will have opportunities to work with senior designers to

Learn design techniques for analog circuits
Learn about custom layout of analog circuits.
Verify circuit designs to ensure that functional and performance targets are achieved using industry standard tools and methodologies.
Regularly present and share design progress to peers and senior engineers
Participate in design reviews of other circuits to maximise exposure to different circuit architectures.

For those interested in learning Digital Design and verification, the successful candidate will have opportunities to work with senior designers to

Learn about spec development and design partitioning.
Gain exposure to implementing digital circuits in RTL
Develop testbenches to verify design functionality
Verify RTL designs using standard industry tools for HDL checking e.g. CDC, RDC, Lint
Learn about backend flows for digital designs – synthesis and Place & Route.
Regularly present and share design progress to peers and senior engineers

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

Students with
Analog or digital circuit design fundamentals
Programming / scripting skills
Interpersonal/teamwork skills
Students who are studying towards a Bachelors or Masters in Electrical / Electronic Engineering or related field
Expect to graduate from your studies in 2025 or 2026

This team is responsible for the Verification of several critical Sub-Systems as well as the integration of lower level IPs and the Sub-System delivery to SoC. The team is responsible for verifying a balanced architecture between power consumption and performance, delivering high complexity RTL code and Verification components, as well as creating advanced testbenches using leading-edge verification techniques.

A successful candidate will work with architects and fellow design and verification leads. The candidate will be highly accurate and detail-oriented, possessing strong communication, mentoring, leadership and problem-solving skills. Can work well with cross functional teams. AMD together we advance_

SMTS Research Engineer

THE ROLE

The AMD Research and Advanced Development in Europe is a small, diverse and dynamic part of AMD that is based in Dublin, Ireland. Our team conducts cutting-edge research in pervasive and sustainable AI working on topics, such as, DNN optimization, compilers and hardware architecture. Through customization and tailored solutions, we investigate how we can enable pervasive and sustainable AI with adaptive devices such as FPGAs and AIEs. We’re pushing the performance and efficiency envelope of what’s possible today to help shape the next big thing in computing. In particular, this includes training paradigms and techniques, novel hardware-friendly topologies, quantization techniques, and custom hardware architectures. Fulfilling this goal requires top talent. Thus, we are looking to enrich our team with the finest engineers with bold, collaborative and creative personalities from universities worldwide.

THE PERSON

We seek enthusiastic engineers preferably with PhD degrees in Machine Learning, Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, and related disciplines. We look for a subset of the following skill sets in our candidates:

PREFERRED SKILLS:

Thorough understanding of compute architectures
Strong background core concepts in neural networks and computer arithmetic.
Fluent in Python, C++ and Linux shell scripting.
Experience with Vivado HLS, Vivado IP Integrator or SDAccel is a strong plus.
Experience with common machine learning frameworks (Caffe, TensorFlow, PyTorch) is a strong plus.
Experience with hardware design in VHDL or (System)Verilog is a plus.
Strong communication skills, verbal and written.

You will join a team whose architecture and systems activities cover a wide range of disciplines including machine learning for data center (HPC) and embedded computing applications; emerging memory technologies; on-chip interconnects; specification, modelling and analysis of modern heterogeneous multicore architectures.

Creating and using analytical performance projection tools targeting AI/ML applications running on modern heterogeneous multicore architectures
ing strong software engineering skills to implement/improve performance optimization techniques to be integrated into performance projection tool flows
Provide results/reports that drive the definition and specification of the next-generation architectures
Technical interaction with internal engineering teams and AMD customers

Preferred Experience

PhD/MS/BS Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
Strong understanding of the state of the art/emerging ML algorithms and their mapping onto modern heterogeneous multicore architectures
Experienced in using popular ML frameworks, such as Pytorch, Tensorflow, ONNX
Strong understanding of the quantization techniques, such as PTQ, QAT
Strong C/C++ programming experience and scripting skills (python/shell)
Effective communication and problem-solving skills

Academic Credentials

Bachelor’s or Master's or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent.

WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

Responsibilities:

MTS SILICON DESIGN ENGINEER

THE ROLE:

This role is an excellent opportunity to work on the next generation technologies that will be part of future AMD ASICs powering Servers and Machine Learning Applications. You will join one of the fastest-growing field of data-processing units rapidly being adopted across the VLSI industry. The industry is moving towards adding custom hardware offload engines to support complex data operations like encryption, authentication, compression, GPU/CPU compute offloads & virtual machines live migration. This is a tremendous opportunity to get in early into a rapidly expanding domain of custom hardware accelerators.

THE PERSON:

Enjoys an environment where they can grow and learn with sense of global team spirit.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills, excellent attention to detail.
Eagerness to learn new designs and implementation techniques.
Must have good collaboration, flexible, patience and interpersonal skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Micro-architecture of simple to complex digital blocks.
RTL development using best industry practices, multi-clock, high frequency designs, low power & latency and high performance
Debugging, post silicon bring up
Documentation
Optimize design for key metrics like Area, Power, Performance etc.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams like DFT, Implementation, Verification, Emulation, Firmware regularly.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience with design of complex digital logic.
Experience with Data Accelerator Hardware offload Engines like encryption, compression etc.
Experience with scripting/automation languages like Python/Perl.
Experience with state-of-the-art industry standard digital tools
Knowledge of challenges faced, while using lower node technologies.

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:

Bachelors or Masters degree in computer engineering/Electrical Engineering

#LI-PL1
#LI-Hybrid

Qualifications:

AMD together we advance_

Responsibilities:

THE ROLE:

AMD is looking for a Design Verification Engineer willing to take on the challenge of becoming part of the PCIe Sub-System Design Verification team. In this role you will be given an opportunity to work on the next generation technology that will be part of future AMD Microprocessors powering Gaming Consoles, Servers and Personal Computers as well as Graphics Cards and VR sets. This team is responsible for the Verification of several critical Sub-Systems as well as the integration of lower level IPs and the Sub-System delivery to SoC. The team is responsible for verifying a balanced architecture between power consumption and performance, delivering high complexity RTL code and Verification components, as well as creating advanced testbenches using leading-edge verification techniques.

THE PERSON:

A successful candidate will work with senior silicon design engineers. The candidate will be highly accurate and detail-oriented, possessing good communication and problem-solving skills.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with high-speed, low power digital circuit designs from definition to implementation
Verification of critical high speed digital designs using both coverage driven random and directed testing techniques as well as Formal verification.
Own some or all aspects of the Verification flow from initial test planning to coverage convergence and sign-off closure for one or more features and aspects of Sub-System level IP interoperability.
Building testbench components as well as developing test and sequence libraries, by applying Objected Oriented Programming Verification techniques following UVM methodology.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Strong background in ASIC Design Flow
Expertise in Design Verification
Proficient in SystemVerilog and scripting languages like Python, Perl, Ruby, Makefile, shell
Experience verifying complex designs using UVM, OVM or VMM
Proficient in debugging firmware and RTL code using simulation tools
Automating workflows in a distributed compute environment.
Familiarity with industry standard high-speed protocols such as PCIe, SATA, USB or Ethernet is a plus
Experience with verification of Hardware-Firmware interaction is highly desirable
Exposure to simulation profile, efficiency improvement, acceleration, HLS tools/process
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with pronounced attention to detail
Capable of independently driving tasks and activities to completion in an organized and timely manner with excellent quality

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:

Bachelors or Masters degree in computer engineering/Electrical Engineering

description:
#### **About you**


Are you a visionary product manager with a passion for innovation and a knack for translating market analysis and data into winning product strategies? Openmind Networks, a team of pioneers shaping the tech landscape, seeks your brilliance!

#### **Your profile**

**The Mission**

  

As our Strategic Product Manager, you'll be the driving force behind our cutting-edge products, taking the lead on every stage of their journey. You'll:

* *Chart the Course:* Become a market expert, conducting in-depth market research and competitive analysis to inform strategic product roadmaps that position us for long-term success.
* *Innovate and Deliver:* Guide products from ideation through launch and beyond, continuously optimizing every aspect for maximum customer satisfaction and revenue growth.
* *Make Data-Driven Decisions:* Mastermind data analysis, turning insights into actionable strategies that propel product development and ensure continuous improvement.

 **What You Bring to the Table**

* *Strategic Thinker:* Your mind is a powerhouse of market analysis, spotting trends and opportunities with ease.
* *Collaborative Leader:* You effortlessly bring together cross-functional teams to achieve outstanding results.
* *Tech Enthusiast:* Bonus points for previous product management experience in tech, telecoms, or SaaS, showcasing your ability to deliver exceptional value

 **The Openmind Culture**

  

We're not just about the work; we're about building a community where everyone can thrive.


You can expect:

 *A Growth Mindset:* We believe in challenging ourselves and empowering you to do the same.

*Passionate Peers:* Collaborate with brilliant colleagues who share your drive to make a difference.

*Impactful Projects:* Your work will directly shape the future of our company and the industry.

#### **About us**


Openmind is an inclusive and equal opportunities employer. We own our commitment to creating an equitable workplace, where everyone can thrive regardless of gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race. We care for each individual, valuing diversity and embracing uniqueness. Join us and be part of a culture where we live these values, master our craft, and evolve together towards a better future.

  

Openmind Networks is an independent technology company focused on mobile messaging software and services for the telecoms industry. Openmind messaging solutions allow telecoms firms to consolidate their core messaging, protect their network and unlock the potential in business messaging and 5G. Boasting a highly experienced team of engineers, Openmind has consistently led the way in bringing new innovations to the mobile messaging market.

  

We are responsible for delivering over 1 billion messages a day with our global customer base which includes some of the world’s largest Mobile Operators, Wholesale Intercarriers, Aggregators and Social Media providers.

company_object.name: Openmind Networks
company_object.long_description:
Openmind Networks Ltd is a global organisation with its head office in Dublin, Ireland. It operates a single powerful platform that offers multiple communication services to all market segments within the Telecoms Industry. Each day the platform delivers over 1 billion messages worldwide to customers including network operators, inter-carrier operators and global giants in social media. 

Winner of Deloitte Best Managed Company Award 2015, Openmind Networks is going from strength to strength and has now expanded its business to Silicon Valley in the US, where its primary focus is on a new offering to the App economy called Golgi.

description:
Elio Networks helps thousands of organizations improve their connectivity & unified communications needs. We are Dublin’s largest fixed wireless internet service provider & provide global fibre connectivity solutions that power the world’s SME & International Corporate businesses. We’re headquartered in Trinity Street, Dublin 2 & have been in business since 2008 so you can learn & develop from our highly experienced team.

Elio Networks is part of *D9 Infrastructure* whose name was inspired by The UN Sustainable Development Goal #9. Environmental, social, and governance criteria are at the epicentre D9’s approach.

This shows our unwavering commitment to positive progress, improving connectivity globally and environmentally sustainable digital infrastructure. We off set our carbon footprint with Climate Partners & working towards being carbon neutral……...ESG is at the heart of all our decisions.

Job Description

**The role** As an engineer in Elio, you will be joining a team building and managing a fast-growing network in terms of speed, density, span, and customer numbers. You will be expected to understand and work with a combination of various wireless technologies, dark and lit fibre, power technologies, and routers. We aim for a high uptime and quick resolution of any issues. To achieve this, we ensure all NOC members have a broad knowledge of all parts of our network, to allow us to determine a cause, and implement any required fix in as quick as time as possible.Within the NOC, you will be dealing with customers, ensuring that for any touchpoints, they are having the best possible service, whether that be a Pre-Sales question from a salesperson, a provisioning call, or when there is an issue with the connection. You’ll be participating in the on-call rota and be work within any major incident response when/if required.You’ll be given an opportunity to research and experiment, finding new technologies and resources which we can implement to ensure that we can continue to grow and continue to be trusted by our customers.Key Responsibilities  
Assist in troubleshooting network issues and outages.  
Work with network diagnostic tools and software.  
Document network configurations, changes, and problems.  
Collaborate with the team to enhance network performance and reliability.  
Working with multiple types of wireless equipment, lit and dark fibre as well as routers from multiple vendors.Qualifications

Qualifications

**Requirements**  
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Telecommunications, or related field OR 1-2 years’ experience in a network engineer role, preferably in a WISP environment.  
Solid knowledge of wireless communication principles, IP networking, and network diagnostic tools.  
Knowledge of TCP/IP networking.  
Strong problem-solving skills and customer service orientation.  
Experience with Linux, scripting, python, or Java is a plus.  
Empathy is an absolute must.  
Fluency in English  
Local area knowledge would be beneficial.

Additional Information  
We offer excellent career prospects in a dynamic business environment. We offer fantastic benefit packages and the chance to work with a leading connectivity provider. We focus on looking after our people, so they will maintain the excellent service we offer to our customers.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From €35,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Bike to work scheme
* Company events
* Company pension
* Gym membership
* Private dental insurance
* Private medical insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus pay

* Performance bonus

Language:

* English (required)

Licence/Certification:

* CCNA (required)

Work authorisation:

Ability to Commute:

* Arbour Hill, Dublin, CO. Dublin (required)

Ability to Relocate:

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Arbour Hill, Dublin, CO. Dublin

description:
Glanbia Business Services
  
  

Join this dynamic team focused on delivering better nutrition for every step of life’s journey
  
  

The Opportunity
  
A vacancy has arisen for the role of SAP Basis Support Engineer at Glanbia Business Services. This is a permanent position & will report to the Application Technology Manager.
  
  

Glanbia plc operates a world-class Business Applications suite comprising SAP and other Enterprise class solutions , both on premise and cloud based , to support the business in reaching its objectives. The SAP Basis Support Engineer will be part of the team responsible for the on-going design and support of IT enabled solutions for the global business.
  
  

Participate in the Technical Administration, Integration & Support (Netweaver/Basis) for the group SAP eco-system both on-premise and Cloud based (hybrid)
  
Participate in the Technical Administration & Support of the group non-SAP systems
  
Support of the in-house Application Development, Glanbia Business Services Centres of Excellence and Business Application Support Teams.
  
Working with the wider Technical Teams to deliver additional functionality / components as required by the Business.
  
P articipate in the design of the ongoing evolution of the on premise solution landscape which will also encompass SAP Analytics Cloud , Datasphere , C4C , BTP , CPI etc
  
  

The skills you will bring to the team
  
Third level qualification in Computing/Information Technology or equivalent
  
3+ years SAP NetWeaver Administration experience or equivalent enterprise class system administration/DBA experience
  
Proficiency in one or more SAP technologies (Eg ECC, S/4Hana, BW, BO, C4C, BTP ) would be an advantage
  
Experience in cloud technologies/integration desirable
  
Exposure to planning, design, installation, and technical configuration of SAP components
  
Strong technical aptitude
  
  

Where & how you will work
  
The base location of the role will be Kilkenny or Dublin 24, with a hybrid working arrangement available through our Smart working model which allows you a greater choice in how you work and live, giving you a better work-life balance.
  
  

What we would like to offer you!
  
The opportunity to develop your career on a global stage, continuous learning through an on-demand learning platform, and a competitive compensation package including staff discounts
  
About Glanbia
  
**The Glanbia Group comprises three divisions:** Glanbia Performance Nutrition , Glanbia Nutritional's, and Joint Ventures . Collectively and with our partners we offer an incredible breadth of expertise in nutrition. We employ a team of 6,000 people, work with global food and beverage companies, and sell our award-winning and market-leading products in 130 countries worldwide.
  
At Glanbia, we celebrate diversity, because we know that our individual strengths make us stronger together. We welcome and encourage interest from a variety of candidates, we will give your application consideration, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.
  
  

At Glanbia, our culture celebrates individuality, knowing that together we are more.

Our  heritage  is in dairy, but we've  evolved  to become  a global  nutrition leader,  home  to brands  and ingredients  that help people  around  the world  perform  well, recover  quickly, and  stay strong, at any age. The future  of  food  is personal — we  continue to grow,  using insight-and science-led  innovation  to deliver  the high-quality  nutrition  our consumers  need. The  choices we  make every  day are  guided  by our purpose — we're  here  to help  people  live  their best, while  doing  better by each other  and the earth.

job_title: Label Printer and barcode scanner support engineer
description:
*Technical Support Engineer.*

*The company*

Business Support Systems is a labelling solutions company based in Swords. We supply organisations with the tools and knowledge they need to produce their own labels on site when they need them and hardware to allow automatic collection of data. We sell major brands including Zebra and Brother label printers, Nice Label and Bartender Label Design Software, and Zebra and Datalogic barcode scanners and mobile computers. We are also a Zebra Supplies Specialist selling Zebra's high quality range of labels and ribbons.

*The position*

We are currently seeking to recruit a technical support engineer. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing technical support to both staff and customers. They will also be required to take a deep dive into the products and offerings available from our vendors to understand their potential, identify opportunities and support the rollout of those offerings. You will be working in an environment that requires constant learning. One in which you wll be required to provide your colleagues and customers with ongoing education on the products and solutions we sell.

Responsibilities will include

* Provide telephone technical assistance to our customers on both hardware and software.
* Assess and repair label printers and other hardware equipment.
* Manage and co-ordinate third party repair work.
* Design and print label samples as required.
* Testing of print materials.
* Run label print jobs for customers.
* Visit customer sites to provide technical support and training.
* Visit customer sites to install and help implement solutions.
* Advise the sales team on possible solution options.
* Advise the sales team on the functionality of products and solutions.
* Advise and propose how we can supply and support new product offerings.
* Identify and advise on possible new product offerings.
* Develop a deep understanding of products.
* Provide in house technical support.
* Provide support and assistance to colleagues.
* Attend a regular product and solution review meeting.
* Carry out some general office duties.

*The Person*

The successful candidate will ideally have the following characteristics

* Experience working with barcode label printers, barcode scanners and label design software packages.
* A working knowledge of barcodes.
* An ability to explain things clearly and concisely.
* A calm disposition.
* Patience.
* A good listener.
* Co-operative and collaborative.
* A team player.
* Attention to detail.
* Someone who values the importance of good quality.
* A helpful disposition.
* You can describe yourself as honest and place a high value on integrity.
* Hardworking.
* You have an ethos of customer care.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: €36,000.00-€40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Sick pay
Schedule:
* Monday to Friday
Supplemental pay types:
* Bonus pay



Application question(s):

* English at an advanced level (required)


Work Location: In person


Reference ID: Tech01
Expected start date: 12/02/2024

description:
_*Be part of an innovative and progressive company in the West!*_

_ *Bí páirteach i gcuideachta nuálach agus forásach san Iarthar!*_



ÉireComposites based in Connemara, is an innovative design, manufacturing and testing company, involved in lightweight, high-performance fibre-reinforced composite materials, with an international blue-chip customer base of over 70 companies in the aerospace, renewable energy and automotive sectors. ÉireComposites has established accredited aerospace composites manufacturing and testing facilities in Galway, Ireland and has significant intellectual property in manufacturing and tooling for composite materials. Remote work is not available for this position.

This role would suit a candidate looking to work locally in Connemara in a friendly environment that is both supportive and friendly. Why not apply today to see where your career could take you. Training is provided on the job.



*Responsibilities include:*

· Follow detailed assembly instructions, processes, and procedures to correctly. manufacture and assemble composite parts to meet individual customer requirements.

· Complete all records required as per processes/procedures and training provided.

· Report problems with quality, processes, equipment, or materials to the Production Supervisor immediately.

· Support the movement of materials and use of lifting equipment.

· Operate machinery, tools, and aids as required.

· Complete routine tasks with minimal supervision.

· Maintain a clean and organized work area to facilitate manufacturing functions.

· Work in a cleanroom environment area and industrial production as needed.

· Undertake all other duties as assigned by the Production Supervisor.



*Core Job Requirements:*

· Excellent attention to detail is required.

· Excellent manual dexterity and co-ordination is required.

· Experience in measuring, cutting and or making things with your hands is advantageous.

· Work experience in a manufacturing team environment is preferred although not essential.

· Individual will be required to be mobile, with frequent standing, bending, reaching grasping, stooping and walking are requirements for role.

· Proficiency in the English language is required.

· Ability to learn on the job and have a willingness to update skills and versatility in core business areas as required.

· The prospective candidate must be able to demonstrate a positive can-do attitude, professional approach and self-motivation in completing assigned tasks.

· Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

· Demonstrates good problem-solving capability.

· Full European/Irish Driver’s License is required.

· Leaving certificate or equivalent is preferred although not essential.

·

Salary: €26,000.00 per year. Salary and Job role requirements are reviewed as part of the six-month probation process, again at twelve months and thereafter annually in line with the company performance management process and business performance.



Please submit your own C.V. format. Unfortunately, we cannot respond to all CVs received due to volumes. However, we will respond to candidates who attend for interview and provide feedback if requested. All our job descriptions are available in full in both English and Irish on www.eirecomposites.com, where you will also find out more information about our business. Please submit your CV to hr@eirecomposites.com.





*Benefits:*

· Competitive Salary.

· Easily accessible – 25 mins from Knocknacarra,

· Permanent role.

· Company Pension plan (three percent company contribution).

· Early finish on a Friday.

· Death in service/life assurance.

· Twenty days annual leave.

· Wellness and team events/initiatives.

· Training & development.

· Work wear provided.

· On-site parking & canteen.

description:
_*Be part of an innovative and progressive company in the West!*_

_*Bí páirteach i gcuideachta nuálach agus forásach san Iarthar!*_

ÉireComposites is a small and dynamic company based in Inverin. EireComposites is involved in innovative design, manufacturing and testing using lightweight, high-performance fibre-reinforced composite materials. We make composite parts and products for a range of sectors ranging from renewable energy, sports, marine to automotive sectors.

This role would suit a candidate who wants to work locally in Connemara in a friendly environment that is both supportive and friendly. Why not apply today to see where your career could take you. Highly trained employees are ready to share their knowledge and help you get started in your new role. We are seeking to hire a manufacturing technician who will be responsible for manufacturing work relating to the renewable energy and marine sectors.

*Main Duties include:*

* Manufacturing of wooden moulds and fixtures.
* Manufacture of steel frames.
* Manufacture of composite laminates.
* To support across all departments with the analysis of material samples.
* Working knowledge of boats and the marine industry.
* Ad hoc duties that may arise.

*Skills / Competencies:*

* Trade qualification in carpentry or other trade qualification.
* Experience in construction, setting out, fitting, or finishing.
* Experience working in a manufacturing environment.
* Knowledge of various tooling and testing equipment.
* Ability to work as part of a team or on own initiative.
* General problem-solving ability.
* Ability to read drawings.

*Core Job Requirements:*

· Must be able to demonstrate a positive can-do attitude, attention to detail, good problem solving and self-motivation in completing assigned tasks.

description:
**Apprentice Field Service Engineer - Connacht**
================================================

Functional area: Service
Country: Ireland
City: Connacht, Galway
Company name: Atlas Copco (Ireland) Ltd
Date of posting: Feb 26, 2024  

**Passionate people create exceptional things**

Did you know that the solutions we develop are a key part of most industries? Electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more.


We´re everywhere! Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations. With our inclusive and caring environment, you get the support and inspiration you need to grow.


Here, your ideas are embraced, and you never stop learning. Interested in being part of our team?


**Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.**

  


Is your day successful if you can keep machines running and if customers are satisfied? As a Apprentice Field Service Engineer, do you enjoy having a team of colleagues that look after your daily planning, and support you remotely when you are facing more complex technical issues? Reporting to the Regional Service Manager, you will work as part of a team for your designated region.

  

  

**The role:**


* Studying towards a full engineering apprenticeship by successfully completing all external assessments.
* Craft apprenticeships will develop both on site skills and classroom learnings that are spread over the duration of the apprenticeship.
* Working in the field with qualified service engineers to gain valuable on the job experience.
* Carrying out servicing and maintenance on customer machines, diagnosing mechanical and electrical faults.
* Ordering spare parts for service orders, liaising with internal teams.
* Performing related duties as and when required

  

  

**To succeed, you will need:**


* Have a minimum of grade D in any five subjects in the Junior Certificate or equivalent.
* An interest and basic knowledge in engineering or mechanical processes.
* Be willing to study away from home for periods throughout the apprenticeship.
* Have a clean full driving license (held for a minimum of 1 year).
* Have good computer literacy skills, including a working knowledge of Word & Excel
* Bestrong communicator with the ability to express ideas and receive and exchange information clearly
* Be customer focused with the ability to maintain a good level of customer satisfaction and taking action when needed to meet the expectations of the customer.
* Have the ability to showcase critical thinking, and the ability to identify alternatives to current thinking, in order to develop and implement innovative solutions to problems.
* Be committed, and hardworking, willing to invest in their own future with this great opportunity

  

  

**In return, we offer you:**


* A positive team-working atmosphere, encouraging innovation and collaboration
* Onsite training with an experienced Compressor Engineer for your initial months
* Additional training from the Technical support team, throughout your career
* You will be provided with a laptop and mobile phone to keep you connected whilst out in the field
* Your safety is our priority so full PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) is also provided
* Ongoing support – Regular contact with your team through regular ‘Toolbox’ meetings, plus a dedicated Regional Service Manager within your geographical region
* A career…We value our employees, we invest in their training and developing, and we will give you the opportunity to grow and progress within the company
* A great benefits package, including a desirable pension scheme, private medical insurance, minimum 25 days annual leave and more.

  


**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**  

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

Atlas Copco is global leader of sustainable productivity solutions. To our customers, we are a local company; at the same time, Atlas Copco is a global enterprise with worldwide resources.

description:
**Sales Engineer**
==================

Functional area: Sales
Country: Ireland
City: Clare, Dublin, Galway, Kildare, Laois, Limerick, M
Company name: Atlas Copco (Ireland) Ltd
Date of posting: Feb 16, 2024
Our solutions are a key part of most industries - electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations.


**Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.**

  


**Sales Engineer – Capital Equipment**

  

We are looking for a strong sales person with the drive and motivation to succeed, to go the ‘extra mile’ for an organisation that values your input and will give you the support you need to thrive.


Atlas Copco Ireland are looking to maximise sales of capital equipment within of the Republic of Ireland. As a Sales Engineer out in the field, you will have the opportunity to promote the business through development of the customer base.  



**The role:**


* Visit customers as part of the sales and marketing of all the Oil Free Division Product Portfolio in the 26 counties of Ireland while continuing to develop relationships to a set number of key accounts.
* To undertake proposals and manage technical bid submittals, including the calculation of sales prices to achieve sales that includes internal design reviews, sending CAD & PDF product drawings, P&ID mark-ups, system design review with clients and the assembly and provision of bid documents and populating data sheets as required and follow-up as needed.
* To include for the review of all RFQ's and prepare all Bid Offers to include pre and post follow up requirements of the customer i.e. all documentation, drawings technical issues etc.
* To support sales with demonstration, exhibition and negotiation in order to achieve targets
* To review Terms and conditions associated with all such project and agree T&C's with clients on the award of all contracts
* To support sales through undertaking site surveys and providing technical advice to both existing and potential customers which can include calculating energy usage, system performance, pressure drops, pipe sizing, and control philosophies.
* To mentor and guide both colleagues and clients to ensure that they stay abreast of Atlas Copco product developments and offerings
* To ensure that an excellent standard of after sales service is provided
* To support sales through the effective provision of sales data, including the timely recording of visit and action reports (including lost order reports) and analysis of sales performance against budget
* To promote the business nationally, by supporting the Business Line Manager and other team members in achieving sales

  




**To succeed, you will need:**


* Experience in sales
* Compressor, Blowers, Industrial Gases, Chillers or air treatment experience
* Experience in electrical or mechanical engineering
* Mechanical or electrical engineering degree. Qualification by experience can be proven
* Business analysis skills
* Full Irish driving license – ideally it will be clean but if not, will have less than 4 points
* Excellent computer literacy, able to learn new systems
* Good standard of presentation skills
* Able to travel throughout allocated work area on a daily basis

  




**In return, we offer you:**


* A small, interactive and supportive team, ready to welcome you.
* Backing of a 150 year old international company with a global presence
* Daily engagement with your Business Line Manager, face-to-face and over teams or the telephone.
* Training throughout your career, with at least 40 hours invested in you per year.
* Confidence in the fact that you will be selling the most energy efficient products from the global leader in their segment
* An excellent benefits package – including a company car, laptop and smartphone to get you set up in the field. 25 holidays per year + bank holidays and access to excellent company Health insurance, Life insurance and Pension plan.
* A satisfying career – We are passionate about development & progression of our employees.

  


**Where will your passion take you?**  

At Atlas Copco we believe in challenging the status quo, always looking for a better way. Our leading-edge technology and close customer collaboration enable us to innovate for a sustainable future. We believe that passionate people make it happen. With us, you have the authority to act and many opportunities to create lasting results.  

We offer a wide range of interesting job roles and many opportunities to grow. This is where it begins – Join us at the Home of Industrial Ideas.

description:
Project and Sales Support Engineer
Functional area: Sales
Country: Ireland
City: Dublin
Company name: Atlas Copco (Ireland) Ltd
Date of posting: Jan 29, 2024

Our solutions are a key part of most industries - electronics, medical research, renewable energy, food production, infrastructure and many more. Working with us means working with the latest technologies and groundbreaking, sustainable innovations.

Join us on our journey for a better tomorrow.

Project and Sales Support Engineer - Ireland

Reporting into the Business Line Manager, you will be contributing to the profitable growth of the Atlas Copco Compressor business through the assisting and supporting the management of sales contracts and projects. The role covers all the company’s product ranges including compressors, blowers, chillers, air treatment products and control systems and includes the project management of packages assembled either internally at our factories or at an external supplier.

The role:

Contribute to the effective running of projects for packaged equipment to ensure they meet client and contract requirements, documentation management, program, quality and safety.
Communicate with clients/customers, resolving any issues or queries relating to the contract management in a timely and professional manner.
Support sales with remote data loggings and energy audits on systems, validation of leads and pre-sales documentation and quotations as necessary.
Support coordination of the dispatch, delivery, unloading and installation of the company’s products with customers, installers and the sales team as necessary.
Highlight changes and variations to the project at the earliest opportunity, including appropriate cost implications and changes to program.
Detail and arrange the purchase of sub-supplier equipment as required by the contract or project for all key materials identified within the tender, ensuring delivery and budget expectations are achieved.
Provide as required, accurate project reports on the progress and financial performance.
Plan and prioritise activities and customer contact towards achieving agreed business aims, including costs – especially managing time and productivity while working on multiple contracts at the same time.
Support proposal preparation, technically and commercially including the calculation of costing analysis to achieve sales.
Develop and maintain good customer relationships and ensure an excellent standard of customer care is provided.
Assist in developing the teams drive towards Customer Care ensuring the highest level of support is offered to all Customers.

To succeed, you will need:

Have an understanding and an ability to apply engineering principles and judgement.
Have an understanding of sales and project management principles and how to effectively organise and support a project.
Have high level of written presentation skills with an eye for detail.
Have an understanding of technically and commercially detailed contracts.
Have excellent communication skills and good interpersonal skills.
Be adept in the use of Microsoft packages, particularly Project, Excel, Word.
Be able to occasionally travel to client sites within the Ireland

In return, we offer you:

A positive team-working atmosphere, encouraging innovation and collaboration
Onsite training with an experienced Compressor Engineer for your initial months
You will be provided with a laptop and mobile phone to keep you connected whilst out in the field
A career…We value our employees, we invest in their training and developing, and we will give you the opportunity to grow and progress within the company
A great benefits package, including a desirable pension scheme, private medical insurance, minimum 25 days annual leave and more.

Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice
Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

About Edwards

Edwards is a leading developer and manufacturer of sophisticated vacuum products, exhaust management systems and related value-added services. Edwards solutions are integral to manufacturing processes for semiconductors, flat panel displays, LEDs and solar cells. They are also used within an increasingly diverse range of industrial processes including power, glass and other coating applications; steel and other metallurgy; pharmaceutical and chemical; and for scientific instruments in a wide range of R&D applications.

Edwards has over 4,000 employees worldwide engaged in the design, manufacture and support of high technology vacuum and exhaust management equipment. Edwards has state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Europe, Asia and North America.

SATIR is a leading provider of Thermal Imaging cameras

This role will require providing first level phone, email and remote technical support to SATIR customers around the world.

The successful candidate will need to display a strong independent work ethic and the ability to work collaboratively within the SATIR team. The individual will be required to display strong troubleshooting, problem-solving and IT skills.

*Primary Responsibilities*
*Technical Support*

* Handle assigned phone and email support cases
* Provide excellent customer experience and timely response to all support issues
* Manage support cases to timely resolution or escalation
* Provide remote application support to customers (if required)
* Update customers on all stages of support cases, from logging to research, action & resolution
* Provide pricing and costs for out of warranty service and repairs
* Issue invoices and repair documents

*Quality Assurance*

* Experience of ISO 9001:2015 is preferred.
* Work closely with internal and third-party product owners as required to resolve support cases
* Maintain knowledgebase & share knowledge with the team
* Create & publish customer facing support information such as best practice guides, FAQ’s, manuals, etc.

*Other Duties as Assigned*

* New Product hardware and software testing
* Product shipping and tracking
* Assist with Office IT Systems
* Sales support

Job Type: Full-time

description:
**About Xerotech**



Xerotech is a battery technology company that is solving one of the greatest challenges of our generation, industrial electrification. Our talented team is making an impact on a global scale, driven by a shared vision of a fully electric future. We thrive in a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative culture where no two days are the same. We take on big challenges and we appreciate every opportunity to learn along the way. When you join Xerotech, you join a team with a thirst for innovation and a hunger for the fun that comes from turning an industry on its head.

  


**Machine Design Engineer**



This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced **Machine Design Engineer** to work as part of the Machine Build Department. This is a once in a life-time opportunity for the person with the right skillset.

  


**In this role you'll get to:**


* Work within the design team to develop innovative concepts from customer requirements
* 3D Design of Mechatronic equipment including mechanisms; transfer systems, servo systems, robotics, pneumatics, electrical equipment, and machine guarding systems
* Hands on involvement at the build and de-bug stage to ensure designs meet performance specifications.
* Ability to take responsibility for large projects and manage cross functional teams through the life cycle of a project
	+ Give guidance and direction to machine build technicians to help them realise designs
	+ Ensure that the end goals are being achieved.
* Design and implement process improvements for existing automation equipment
* Prepare detailed tooling drawings and pneumatic schematics
* Liaise with suppliers for component procurement
* Liaising with other departments on requirement specifications and project deliverables
* Preparing detailed safety risk assessments and FMEAs
* Development of machine documentation to meet EU standards
* Meeting project delivery deadlines
* Excellent communication skills are vital as you will have to work within a technical team and be expected to communicate on job specification and issues that are occurring on a day to day basis.
* Responsibility for quality, commissioning and safety of designs complete

  


**To excel you will need:**


* Educated to degree level in a mechanical engineering discipline
* Minimum 4 years relevant experience including:
	+ Involvement in significant automation projects with responsibility for design sign off, installation and commissioning
	+ Extensive experience in a machine design role
* Strong experience using 3D CAD applications e.g. SolidWorks
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Willing to take ownership
* Self-starter with good attention to detail
* Proven track record in problem solving and delivering solutions
* Demonstrate ability to take initiative and be innovative

  


**What we believe**



We believe in people first, always. At Xerotech we value all cultures and backgrounds and truly believe that diversity drives innovation. We are growing fast, that means you will grow fast too and one day you will be able to say you were there at the beginning!

  


**Why work with us**



Situated in West of Ireland, Xerotech offers a place to work like no other, with a dynamic working culture that very few places can replicate or compete with. We are a fast-growing and innovative company that is competing on a global scale, and we pride ourselves on being a great place to work, allowing us to attract the best to be the best! Just some of the benefits Xerotech offer include:

  


* Private Healthcare cover from day one
* Additional private healthcare to cover partners & dependents
* Company Pension
* 23 days annual leave per year
* Bike to Work scheme
* Active sports and social club with events each month
* Corporate gym rates & free fitness classes
* Wellness programs, including an Employee Assistance Program
* Top-notch tech equipment to work with
* Great atmosphere, team spirit and free office snacks
* Free parking & more

  


**Commitment to Quality**



Whether developing new products or writing copy, you will bring thoroughness, high standards, and the interminable curiosity to challenge the status quo, taking impactful risks along the way. Do you see an innovative way to do something? You will be empowered to do it.



Come and do your best work with us.

  



By submitting your application, you agree that Xerotech may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Xerotech Privacy Policy explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Xerotech’s use of your personal information

**About Xerotech:**



Xerotech is a battery technology company that is solving one of the greatest challenges of our generation, industrial electrification. Our talented team is making an impact on a global scale, driven by a shared vision of a fully electric future. This is a once in a life-time opportunity for the person with the right skillset.

  


**Test Engineering Manager**



This role will have direct responsibility for delivery of the 2024 Xerotech test & validation campaign which ranges from cell level, module level, pack level through to system level. Major elements of this role will be developing and maintaining ongoing test campaigns and infrastructure development to support the continuing development of the Hibernium™ platform.

  



This is an exciting opportunity for a talented **Test Engineering Manager** to join our fast-growing Test team.

  


**In this role you’ll get to:**


* You will be responsible for the execution of Xerotech’s test & validation campaign. You will be tasked with a single overarching goal of proving that the Xerotech Hibernium™ platform is robust and reliable.
* You will get to build and develop a multi-million euro test & validation infrastructure for cell, module, pack and system level high-voltage lithium-ion batteries.
* You will have a deep full-spectrum in-house capability with regard to test. We do everything ourselves so you will have to build and run a full test lab.
* You will lead a team of around 5 test engineers/technicians.
* You will be exposed to the bleeding edge of electric vehicle battery technology and be responsible for proving and validating the next-generation of battery systems that are disrupting world today.

  


**To excel you will need:**


* This cannot be your first test lab. You need to have demonstrated several years running a multi-million euro test and validation environment.
* You need to know how to buy equipment. You will be responsible for millions of euros of spend on equipment. You need to know how to find good suppliers, perform factory acceptance testing and then lead the installation and commission of that equipment (supported by facilities).
* You need to have led a team of test engineers (minimum 5) and have been responsible for their performance management as well as daily technical direction and objective setting.
* You need experience in a relevant field such as automotive, aerospace or defence with a strong emphasis on environmental testing, shock & vibration and other forms of endurance and reliability testing. Our batteries go everywhere – we have to prove they will work.
* Specific experience from an automotive Tier 1 supplier, automotive OEM or automotive contract engineering consultancy would be **highly advantageous**.
* We build batteries at Xerotech so familiarity with relevant battery testing standards such as UN38.3, ECE R100, UL2580 would be
* Experience and understanding of high power electrical testing (load and duty cycling of high voltage battery packs) would be**highly advantageous.**
* You need to be a clear communicator and proficient in explaining and delivering complex technical information. You will have the authority to stop production lines – you need to be able to explain critical information across departments and functions.

  


**What we believe**



We believe in people first, always. At Xerotech we value all cultures and backgrounds and truly believe that diversity drives innovation. We are growing fast, that means you will grow fast too and one day you will be able to say you were there at the beginning!

* Additional private healthcare to cover partners & dependents
* Company Pension
* 23 days annual leave per year
* Bike to Work scheme
* Active sports and social club with events each month
* Corporate gym rates & free fitness classes
* Wellness programs, including an Employee Assistance Program
* Top-notch tech equipment to work with
* Great atmosphere, team spirit and free office snacks
* Free parking & more

  


**Commitment to Quality**



Whether developing new products or writing copy, you will bring thoroughness, high standards, and the interminable curiosity to challenge the status quo, taking impactful risks along the way. Do you see an innovative way to do something? You will be empowered to do it.

  



Come and do your best work with us.

description:
About Xerotech:

Xerotech is a battery technology company that is solving one of the greatest challenges of our generation, industrial electrification. Our talented team is making an impact on a global scale, driven by a shared vision of a fully electric future. We thrive in a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative culture where no two days are the same. We take on big challenges and we appreciate every opportunity to learn along the way. When you join Xerotech, you join a team with a thirst for innovation and a hunger for the fun that comes from turning an industry on its head.

This is a once in a life-time opportunity for the person with the right skillset.

Injection Mould Process Engineer

This is an exciting opportunity for a talented Injection Mould Process Engineer to join our fast-growing team.

In this role you’ll get to:

Primarily your role will be to carry out new multi cavity mould tool validations following Xerotech’s Injection mould validation processes and function testing.
Support our R&D and Engineering departments polymer selections for testing, processing, and development of new polymers to support current and future NPI projects.
Manage the day-to-day planning and scheduling of the injection mould department working closely with Xerotech’s production planning and procurement teams.
Support the Tooling and Moulding Manager to identify and procure new moulding machines and automation equipment and identify areas where OEE’s can be improved.
Work closely with the Tooling Team taking part in the tooling design reviews as part of the DFM process providing input from a mould processing point of view.
Review and approve component drawings to ensure the part can achieve the specifications noted on the drawings.
Create and control of all the mould validation and quality documentation.
Create and maintain the injection moulding Standard Procure documentation.
Ensure the quality of all the moulded components always meets the Quality criteria. React quickly to resolve quality issues raised during production runs.
Troubleshoot all injection moulding technical issues, finding robust solutions.
Upkeep of mould tool records ensuring all tooling activities are recorded accurately.
Working closely with our toolmakers to ensure smooth running of all mould tools is maintained, from start up, during and shut down, reporting any issues which have been noted.
Manage and control effective solutions for material handling safety in confined and restricted areas, working closely with Xerotech’s warehouse to ensure material supplies are effectively always maintained through “Just in Time” process.
Monitor and support the junior members of the team.
Ensure Xerotech’s Health and safety policies are always enforced, reporting any concerns of risk to health and care to Xerotech’s Health and Safety Manager.
Ensure housekeeping within the department is always maintained to high standard incorporating the 5S tools.
Mentor and support the learnings of junior Moulding Engineers.
Manage all the Injection moulding spares and take ownership of the storage.

To excel you will need:

Experience Injection Mould Process Engineer with minimum of 2 years’ experience with mould process development and validation skills.
Open to talking to anyone who has a minimum of 5 years Mould Tool Setting experience and exposure to Mould Processing activities and is looking to step up to the next level in their career in becoming a Process Engineer, however you must be able to demonstrate your ability and confidence to carry out Mould Process activities.
Experience in programming and running FANUC Injection Mould machines will be a distinct advantage but is not essential.
Experience with hot runner systems, including Valve gate and hot to cold feed systems.
Experience and a good understanding of Polymer Engineering and technology to enable you to support the development of material selections for design concepts.
Experience with Injection moulding welding technologies and processing would be advantageous.
Expert with moulding automation including EoAT, pick and place robots and feed stations.
Basic but capable understanding of all types of injection mould tool designs and manufacturing.
Capable of managing the day-to-day machine maintenance requirements and carrying out and monitoring regular PPM’s as per Xerotech’s PPM policies and procedures.
Good documentation and GMP management.
Health and safety awareness.
5S awareness.
Willing to support, encourage and mentor junior members of the team in their endeavors to progress their knowledge and experience within Injection moulding.

We believe in people first, always. At Xerotech we value all cultures and backgrounds and truly believe that diversity drives innovation. We are growing fast, that means you will grow fast too and one day you will be able to say you were there at the beginning!

Hitachi Energy is a pioneering technology leader that is helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep the factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn from others. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation.

Hitachi Energy has an exciting opportunity for a Primary Electrical Engineer to support the Hitachi Energy Ireland Power Grids Grid Integration Business. The role reports to the Operations Manager and is responsible for electrical design works complying with Hitachi Energy and customer’s standards, procedures, and policies.

The role would be responsible for design authority for an engineering discipline with medium to high complexity. Coordinate engineering assignments across several different projects within the entire value chain efficiently, cost-effectively and in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards and safety requirements.

Mission Statement:

Lead all design engineering activities of a project to assure cost-effective engineering execution of project deliverables in accordance with contract specifications, quality standards, schedule, and safety requirements during the start-up, construction and/or erection, commissioning, maintenance phases.

Your responsibilities:

1. Technical contribution

Acts as a technical lead, approves design deliverables. Reviews all project documents for conformity and quality assurance. Anticipates and solves unprecedented problems, crucial issues and/or unique conditions. Serves as a specialist in the application of advanced concepts and methods.

2. Sales support

Assists in preparing proposal/presentation of engineering projects/programs (provision of bills of materials, estimated engineering hours, etc.).

3. Contract management

Supports Contract Managers in issuing claims (new/change in scope of work, cost impact, time impact, risk quantifications, etc.). Provides quality solutions as per customer requirement and delivers within budget and contract. Ensures adherence to safety standards and mitigates potential risks.

 4. Planning and control

Creates work plans and cost estimates in own area of responsibility Reviews and approves scope, budget and schedule for assignments and ensures quality deliverables on time and within targeted cost. Improves effectiveness of work plan in collaboration with other functions.

 5. Risk and opportunity management

Creates and executes strategies for risk and opportunity management in one’s area of responsibility. Identifies and manages contract risks taking corrective actions to resolve any contract/quality/program/cost issues. Reports any outstanding issues to management, along with recommendations for resolution.

 6. Customer

Works with the customer to shape and deliver solutions and seeks customer feedback to drive and deliver improvements. Attends project meetings and presents specific aspects of engineering assignments.

 7. Supply chain management

Collaborates with the Supply Chain function to ensure that technical requirements for equipment or services are communicated and agreed on with potential suppliers. Provides technical evaluation of supplier proposals and accepts as fit for purpose supplied equipment or services.

 8. Technical leadership and knowledge sharing

Represents function in standardization committees and in communication and conferences pertaining to broad aspects of engineering assignments. Acts as technical specialist/adviser to senior management. Collaborates and networks within Hitachi Energy and externally.

 9. Processes and tools

Reviews, develops and documents quality standards, processes, tools and techniques. Ensures that engineering activities comply with required safety regulations and contractual requirements. Contributes towards continuous improvements of processes and tools for engineering efficiency.

### What the job involves
- As a core part of the R&D team you will design automation robotics and mechanical devices, taking ownership of the development design cycle from concept ideation through first build and beyond as we scale our system to production

- Generous paid time off (PTO) - and we mean it!

Elite Tech Precision, a leading Industrial door and roller shutter company in Ireland, is expanding its team and inviting applications for positions based in Kildare, Dublin, and surrounding areas. We are seeking dedicated individuals to undertake on-site maintenance, repairs, and installations of a variety of Roller doors.

**Location:** Kildare, Dublin, and surrounding areas

**Responsibilities:** As an Industrial Door Technician at Elite Tech Precision, your primary responsibilities will include:

* Carrying out maintenance, repairs, and installations of industrial and automatic doors for our esteemed customers, which include some of Ireland's well-known companies.
* Handling new installations, planned preventive maintenance, scheduled maintenance, and reactive emergency calls to repair products.
* Roller Shutters
* Utilizing company-provided van and phone for efficient service delivery.

**Experience/Requirements:** To excel in this role, you should have:

* Previous experience working with industrial or commercial roller shutters.
* Proficiency with hand and power tools.
* The ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
* Strong initiative and the capability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Diligence in adhering to health and safety protocols.
* A full driver's license, safe pass, and manual handling certificate are essential.

**Perks:**

* Competitive Salary: Up to €40,000.00 per year, depending on experience.
* Company Van & Phone provided.

Join Elite Tech Precision and be a part of a dynamic team contributing to the maintenance and installation of cutting-edge industrial door solutions for prestigious clients in Ireland.

We welcome applicants to apply for apprentice roles in this position, salary negotiable.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: €35,000.00-€40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* On-site parking

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

* Overtime pay

description:
T&T Precision are looking for a Product Lifecycle Management Administrator to join a leading sub-contract manufacturer of machined and sub-assembled goods, based in Cork. As a Product Lifecycle Management Administrator, you will be responsible for ensuring that all design data provided via a number of internal and or external sources is efficiently and effectively added to our ERP system and other supporting systems within our organisation, to provide various departments with effective data to realise the expectations of our customers. As part of this role, you shall interface with the customer in all aspects relating to nonconformance of product, to ensure knowledge capture and management occurs to support a culture of continual improvement

This role would be ideal for an enthusiastic individual and someone with a formal technical engineering background, or has worked in as an ERP administrator within a similar environment with a passion for data management and control.

*Key Responsibilities will include:*
* ERP system operator
* BOM controller
* Practiced in reading and understanding component and or assembly drawings with regards to technical specifications that are key to product conformance and compliance.
* Generating inventory parts within the system to initiate production orders
* Process configuration management data into work orders
* Process customer POs into sales orders
* Generate nonconformance reports within ERP system
* Report out to customer on Return Material Advice notes
* Attention to detail is paramount and ensuring the integrity of the data being used.

*Candidate Requirements:*
* You may have formal technical engineering training and or qualifications.
* Must have ERP experience
* Experience from Medtech/Aerospace industry would be ideal but not essential.
* The successful candidate should be a team player who is able to demonstrate customer focus. You should be adaptable to any work-related processes and working practices.
* You should be permitted to work within IRELAND.
* Attention to detail is paramount and ensuring the integrity of the data being used

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to €40,000.00 per year

Benefits:
* Bike to work scheme
* Flexitime
* On-site parking
* Work from home
Schedule:
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday



Experience:
* ERP systems: 2 years (required)
* engineering: 2 years (required)

Work authorisation:
* Ireland (required)

Ability to Commute:
* Cork, CO. Cork (required)


Work Location: In person
